text: The closest you'll come to actual Boston Pizza on the West Coast. I would have given it more stars however the quality is variable. Sometimes you get a perfect Pizza sometimes you get not so great pizza.

Called to place order... A basic salad and two item pizza...nearly $40?!  Way more than I've paid there before. Not surprised to see they have new owners.  Won't be surprised if they don't last too long.
"I freaking love this place. I always order here. Fast service and the pizza is always hot and tasty. The white pizza is good if you add sauce to it, otherwise it can be alittle dry."

I used to order from this place a ton but the service has gotten so horrible it's not worth it. They generally take over an hour to deliver no matter the time or day. 

Each of the last 4-5 times I have ordered delivery they have forgotten something. Tonight they forgot both marinara sauce and a 2 liter of soda. They have at times changed the drink because they didn't have the one I ordered and didn't think to tell me until they were at the door. One time they gave me frozen mozzarella sticks. When I called to let them know they accused me of lieing and screamed at me. It took them over an hour to bring cooked ones, by this time I didn't even want them. 

The only saving grace is that the pizza is decent. It's not good enough to keep ordering from this place. If I could give it zero stars I would.

Edit:
I tried this place one last time. I had bank card fraud the following day after not using my card for anything else for the past 3-4 days. They also delivered the worlds worst pizza. See image here. http://i.imgur.com/FQ0OHen.jpg?1

I walked in and the place was empty and looks kind of run down. I found out why it was empty after I ordered.  $16 for a medium 3 topping flimsy dough?  Paid for extra cheese and didn't get it.  I think they even put light cheese on it. $16? For one mediun pizza?  One pizza?  For $16? Is there gold flake in the cheese?  Lol, one and done for me.  Never again. Side note, employees at the counter were nice.  But $16? Goodness.

If you are ordering pizza in this area...I'd advise anywhere else (I've had good luck with Streets of New York) Not only did they not bring half of the order they were not willing to refund or even work with me on it. After the guy left i had already let it go until i ate the pizza....mediocre at best. I'm sure the place doesnt consistently perfom like this however if you factor in the price, quality, and customer service that i experienced i can't in good faith recommend it.

I honestly cannot believe I havn't reviewed North End Pizza yet. They are one of my few must-have's in the city, as I prefer to try new places. The caviat with this review is that I have never had true New York pizza, so it can only be compared to the places I have tried.

That said, the pizza here is amazingly delicious. It starts with a chewy thin crust, the only way a pizza should be eaten. I usually get the white pizza (garlic olive oil topped with mozzarella and ricotta), but I have also had the meat pizza. The toppings on that one were a nice, high quality.

I'm happy to say that North End is usually pretty busy when I stop in these days, and most of the other storefronts in the complex are being leased. When I first found this place there were very few people whenever I stopped in.

Overall, try the pizza here. It is worth the 20 minute drive out of my way every time I go.

I love their chicken wings! I do like their Pizza as well because I like the thin crusted pizza, I'm not a fan of thick crust SWEETPEA, you know who you are!! The nice thing about North End is if you give them your email they offer specials every now and then where you can get a large cheese pizza for $9.00.  They also offer the same special if you donate money for fundraisers, like recently they did a fundraiser for Boston's bomb victims.  Also, the owner makes some really awesome garlic chips!!!
Great New York style pizza in Northwest Vegas!! Excellent east coast sauce and crust. Salads are also delicious.

This place has never disappointed. Pizzas: great! Zucchini: mmm! Meatball calzone: tdf! Cannolis: yum! Service: excellent! 

Now to try one of their subs.....

Okay...so I just moved to this side of town..and I was craving some pizza, and had heard and seen the awesome reviews for North End Pizza...and I must say, I'm slightly disappointed. But not disappointed enough to never return, for I have faith in them :)
Ordered the white pizza that everyone keeps raving about...had them add some chicken to it, and a side of "fried dough" for delivery.
Food arrived in a timely fashion, but the pizza which I was craving to be nice and hot and cheesy..was lukewarm. :( bummer.
I mean, the fried dough...which was awesome... arrived hotter than the pizza!! But being that I bet they place the dough in deep hot oil to make them, I would hope they would be....but the pizza...it wasnt even hot....it seemed like it had been sitting out waiting to be delivered more than 5 less than 10 minutes..and the distance from my house to the restaurant, is honestly less than 10 minutes!! 
What happened? Was the delivery guys lil pizza carrier thingy out of heat storing juice?? did he stop and get gas?? idk.... :(
All i know is I was waiting for some hot cheesy make my mouth water type of pizza...and the chicken on the pizza looked like ground beef to me...hmm...idk...it tasted like chicken...but I was expecting slices of grilled chicken...not grounded up looks like beef tastes like chicken...chicken...BUT STILL....I have faith...and I will be back to give them another go..but when I do...I will go to them.

As a former east-coaster when I have a pizza craving this is where I go.  The staff is friendly and they pay attention when you want your pizza a certain way.  In my case I like it well done, but when I ask other places it is more burnt than anything else.  If you are looking for a slice of good thin crust pizza this is the place to go.

I've gotten everything here from the calzones to the subs. The calzones are huge and I'm never disappointed. The environment is very easy going, the staff is super friendly, they always cut my daughters pizza into little pieces for her. I've been coming here for about 2 years and will continue to.

Finally, a decent pizza place out where I live in the northwest. It's true, until now all the pizza places out here are awful. North End is different. They make pizza with thin crust, good sauce that's not spicy and no tomato chunks, and it's a joy to eat. They're obviously from Boston since there is Boston references all over the walls. They're in a kind of out of the way new strip mall off Durango. I'm telling everyone I know to go there. Prices are about average with other pizza places. Try it, you'll like it!

ORDER THE BUFFALO CHICKEN PIZZA, It's my favorite pizza from North End. This has been my favorite pizza place for the last 5 years now. I've never had any problems and the owner and employees have always been friendly, professional, and helpful. I won't go to any other pizza place in town because they just aren't as good. Even with the changing of owner ship, the quality and service are still excellent. I recommend North End to anyone who wants a great pizza and great service. Will be a customer for as long as they're open.
Great pizza and awesome place to hangout with family, love it. Definitely would recommend coming back to this place.

With 14 years in the valley under my belt, you could say that I've looked far and wide for a quality pizza that reminds me of my youth on the East Coast.  North End is by far the closest thing I've found to authentic back East pizza.

The crust is flown in from Boston, which after several visits, I'm sure is the secret.  It's the water used to make the dough that set this crust apart from even the best recipe in Vegas.

It's thin, crispy but not over done, and topped with the perfect sauce.

Service is great and the wait is never too long.

Added bonus, the Slider Truck is in the parking lot of North End every Wednesday night so you can kill two cravings at once!

Fantastic pizza... Thank you North End!

Staff is friendly and the pizza is super yummy!! I eat here at least twice a week!!! (Addicted to pizza lol) I highly recommend. Me and one of my friends also tried the garlic knots yesterday and they were delicious.
Ordered a large pizza, half pepperoni half sausage and onions.   Great flavor and the sauce was tasty.   Can't wait to try more!

BEWARE New owners, food and menu are not what they use to be. Our family loved north end.  We would eat there at least twice a month. After our last visit, I felt the need to rate them; the food is terrible - it now has the quality of Pizza Hut or Subway. We will in search of a new restaurant in the NW.

Love this place. I usually order for pick up and i usually make my own pizza. Grilled chicken with jalapeno. The crust and sauce are amazing. If you decide to dine in they have specials like 2 slices of cheese and a drink for around $5.95, I think? But the food is always good and service is always on point. I'm definitely a regular here.

Tried North End for the first tlme. Big dissapointment. No flavor in the crust or sauce.  I paid over twice the price that I would have across the street at Domino's and received a less quality pizza.

Had a craving for White Pizza on Friday Night. Ordered while on the road and it was waiting for me when I walked in. Met the owner, Claudia, who was very nice and personable. She even walked me to the door and opened it for me! Got home to the Mrs. and shared the pie....DELICIOUS....good crust just the right amount of garlic....A+ for me!

I stop in North End Pizza for a couple of slices of pizza. Being from NY I'm always looking for great pizza. I placed my order and started to wonder around and noticed all this Boston  Red Sox pictures on the wall. I suddenly got a little concerned about the Pizza being I'm a NY Yankee fan what am I doing here. I finally got my Pizza and I was surprised how good it was I was very impressed. I definitely will be back but I have to find a way to not let those RedSox bother me after all the Yankees do have 27 rings.

We had spent the afternoon out in the hot sun and hadn't eaten all day. I'm the kind of girl that needs to eat every two hours or I grow a second head and start screaming about any minuscule thing that happens to set me off. Needless to say, I needed to eat before someone got hurt. 

We had been wanting to try North End Pizza for awhile; so when I felt like devouring 56 slices of saucy cheesey goodness after my day in the sun we decided to finally make the stop. 

No debating for me over what to order. Margherita special for the day? Yes, in a large please. And a side of fries. 

The fries weren't great, weren't bad. I dumped some garlic salt on them and they instantly improved. They brought out the pizza and I was a little disappointed- it was a bit skimpy on the cheese. 

After my first slice I was hooked. The crust is thin but not super thin, the sauce has a lot of flavor, and the mozzarella (what there was of it) was fresh. My husband and I ate the entire large pizza right then and there.

We've eaten here twice now, and I can't give it more than 2 stars.  Even though their prices are pretty low, I still feel like I'm paying too much because the pizzas are SO skimpy!   The crust is pretty good, but the cheese barely even covers the toppings.  That's not my idea of good pizza.   

If you're in the Centennial area and want some good pizza ... keep driving right past North End and go to Mark Rich's.

Called in an order. When we showed up 30 minutes later, they hadn't even started the order. They weren't too busy cause there was only one table with people sitting. I ordered a chicken Parmesan sandwich and it was very weak. It took me a minute of pulling excess amounts of sauce out to find 1 tiny chicken finger in the bottom. Meatballs sub's were the same. Its just a marinara sub with no full meatballs.

Some of the best pizza I had in a while. Ordered the Supreme, and me and my lady split it. Also, had me some of the mozzarella sticks and onion rings. They were tasty as well. I'm getting hungry just thinking about it. I'm going to get me some more tonight. The delivery driver was nice enough, but it is the food that really did it for me. Cheers!

Just picked up a supreme pizza, eggplant parm sub and fried dough dessert. Walmart has better pizza in the frozen case, the eggplant sub was super salty (in-edible) and the fried dough was under cooked, greasy and will also hit the trash can. What a waste of $30, this was an insult to be called an Italian Restaurant.

While I'm not sure about the quality of the food because we couldn't get that far, I find it hard to believe that 3 pizzas an order of knots and mac n cheese bites should be $75.  (Med veg, Large Pep/Bacon, Extra Large Pep)

Now, I could have been persuaded to try the food - even at that price - if the manager was the slightest bit interested in selling it.  Tell me what makes it special.  Why should I choose your over priced items instead of the others?  When I questioned the price, he simply said I could look at the menu to verify the cost.  There's no way I could pay above top dollar for what is essentially fast food given the level of indifference that the manager had concerning my satisfaction as a potential customer.  He really couldn't have cared any less and it showed.  I can't believe that any more care is put into making the food.

This was on a Saturday night when any place with decent food AND service should be busy.  It's easy to see why there were only two people seated (I think one works there) and the phone wasn't ringing.  

I found more pizza (and a lot more toppings) and got the knots that my daughter likes, for $40 right down the road - and they had a menu too! - It even had coupons that they were more than willing to provide... with a genuine smile. - TYVM - Mr. Jims.

I do love North End Pizza. I live over 100 miles from Vegas, but I come to the city regularly to do errands, shop, and EAT! I try to stop at North End for lunch every couple of months or so, and I always get two cheese slices and a drink, extra crispy, to go. :-) They have a special, very reasonable, price for that combo.  And it's true.. their pizza does remind one of what you might find at a million pizza joints in NYC. Thin crust that doesn't turn soggy, even after it cools off, just the right amount of sauce and seasonings, and plenty of cheese. And always served with a smile. I've been going in there for so many years now that one of the guys often recognizes me, and that's nice. Anyway, Kit sez: try it.. you'll like it!

I actually have pretty low standards for pizza. However, this was one of the most depressing pizza I've ever received as a delivery. The crust was soft, the cheese was on its way into a hardened "shell." It felt like my pizza was made that morning or the day before. Even mall cafeteria pizza or hospital pizza was better than this. Maybe it was just a bad day, but I'm scarred from giving them a second chance.

Went in for slices around dinner time. Slices had been sitting for hours. When they came out the cheese was horrible. When ask for new slices they were in no way going to help as they said they were in the 2 hour range of the health department. When we asked for our money back they refused. No wonder there was no one else in the place. Never again.

Great thin crust pizza and service.  We came in at the end of the night and they stayed after to serve us and it was well worth it.  Crust had crunch to it...not many places know how to make a thin crust pizza, but North End does.

Ordered and had it delivered. We ordered a beef sandwich and pasta with meatballs garlic knots and a cannoli. Said the food would take 45 min to be delivered. After an HOUR we called they said the food just left they were backed up. When the food finally got here it was awful. The beef sandwich the bread was burnt completely with no beef, pasta was over done and sauce tasteless, meatballs were like water and garlic knots and cannoli were not good. Save your money and time
Disgusting food. Even more disgusting customer service. Ownership went down the tube. Can't believe they are still open after all the horrible thing I hear now.
Best pizza!  All the food is delicious. Staff is very helpful and friendly. Very clean. My husband and I eat there all the time. You should definitely try it.

We ordered 2 pies and garlic chips to go. Total bill $37. They were thin crust pizza's and were good but not great. On one pie, we ordered it with eggplant and ricotta and the other sausage and mushroom. The garlic chips were just okay nothing special about them. Because it's on the other side of town for me, I don't think I'd drive all the way out here for pizza and that's saying much since I do drive for good food. What I did enjoy however was reading and looking at all the memorabilia used to decorate the place while waiting.  I'd rather have a pizza from Settebello's or Due Forni on any given day.
One of my favorite pizza joints in Vegas. I keep running into regulars every time I go there..The pizza is authentic and service was welcoming and friendly.
Great meat pizza and friendly service. The meatballs on the pizza were fantastic.And *real* Caesar dressing on our Caesar salad, could taste the anchovies!
Excellent pizza. Crust is just right. Good sauce and toppings. 2 slices and a soda for $6!  Good friendly service. Rock on.
i never thought id like ny thin crust pizza since im a chicago style fan. This place is very good, huge slices, tasty crust.. i will come back!
Zero customer service. They got the order wrong and when we complained they told us to take our business elsewhere. I suggest you do the same.

I really loved the portions. Huge slices make you feel like you're doing good by eating two slices which are more like four slices. The service was excellent. Cute atmosphere so my only complaint is the pizza is really pricey. They need to give out coupons or something.
The pizza tasted good, but the crust was over cooked and almost inedible, especially the next day ( and I normally love leftover pizza.

Have been going to this joint for a while now. They use to have good chicken fingers that were freshly made. Now they give you the frozen stuff that you can buy at the grocery store. Pizza is still good!!!

Best pizza around .  I finally found a true back east style pizza.  I asked her how she makes the ingredient so fresh and she says she actually has them shipped from back east.  The dough I prepared there too by her dad with there secret recipe.  
So if you like thin crust pizza you have to give them a try you will not be disappointed.
Always good pizza and try the garlic parm fries! TO DIE FOR!

First time we have ordered from here and online too. Great service was delivered on time and their pizza is ahhmazing! Tastes homemade and even the salad I got was super fresh! Definitely will be ordering again!!
Thin crust pizza, delicious.  Lots of seating, charming decor.  Calzones huge and sauce deelish.

How have they not been shutdown by the health department? They either knowingly used expired/curdled product or no one bothers to check dates or quality before using products. Or they just use such cheap and inferior products, they don't notice they're curdled.

I ordered a white pizza tonight, first order ever from here. What was delivered was inedible, disgusting and rancid. The ricotta cheese was so sour and old, it was grainy and rough; ricotta cheese should be creamy, even after heating.

After an attempt via eat24 to resolve this, they seemingly refused to correct the situation; instead opting to still charge me for a pizza that at this moment, has a family member violently ill. It's going to be a long night...

I'm guessing management was willing to chance not being reviewed publicly or a visit from the health department. 

I would have preferred to leave 0 stars, but that is not an option.  The only recommendation I can make is to avoid this place like the plague, lest you become a victim to poor sanitation and quality control wherein YOU feel like you have the plague.
Awesome NY style pizza. Huge thin slices and the sauce is so good, but with any good NY style pizza there is a lot of grease. With that said it is still one of my favorite pizza places.

Soooo I'm wondering if it's possible to get the owners name. Anyone? We ordered delivery and no joke received our pizza two hours later COLD. I called to let the manager know and when I asked for his name he told me it was none of my business. I asked if i could have the name of another manager, and just my luck he is the only manager of the entire place.  I asked when the owner would be available and just my luck the owner is on vacation. Cool! This is the worst place possible. Above the crust pizza is soooo much better. I will never order from here again.

The first time I tried North End, I thought to myself "MEH, its OK...." I wasn't wowed or anything. Now fast forward about a year later and buying 3 kick-@ss Groupons for the joint and my feelings have changed. I think they have a pretty good pie, thin crust, good sauce, and tasty cheese. You grew on me baby, you should thank Groupon for that.

Like others here, have tried to give this place chance after chance but after realizing it's just not going to get better, have decided to close the book on this one.  The horror starts upon walking into their establishment,  No air conditioning and some pretty uncaring workers behind the counter that don't say thank you after adding a tip to their already overpriced cheese bread.  And really that's all you're paying for:  flavorless greasy cheese bread.  Thin and boring.  At least there are several other options in the area when it comes to pizza.  The quest for the best continues....
Love the pizza crust!!! Also tried my first cannoli and it was yummmmy! Took about 50min to get my delivery order so not to bad. Will order again.

I really wanted to like you North End Pizza, I really did.  I read your fabulous reviews, read the positive commentary regarding your crust, toppings and sauce and when I came in there on July 11 and saw you sitting there on the warmer, I thought it would be love at first sight.  Instead I took you to my best friend's apartment, ate you up and you left me feeling empty, not in my stomach, because you actually made me sick, but on the inside.

Seriously, just average pizza.  I've had better NY style pizza at multiple locations.  Another overly hyped joint that doesn't live up to its fanfare.  This is not to say I wouldn't possibly go back, I could see this stuff soaking up some alcohol whenever I get drunk again.
Not sure what changed in the last year but they have definitely gone downhill in quality. What once was my favorite Pizza has now become mediocre at best. So sad :(

Nothing like a Val Pak coupon yet again to 'force' me to go to North End.  Before the weekend is over I'll probably have to pay another visit.  I always wanted a good place right near where I lived, but now I may be regretting it. LOL

I was having some friend over so I ordered this for delivery.  I've ordered from them a couple times before but don't really remember our thoughts on it.  I ordered 2 large pizzas and a small order of garlic knots.  They already had me in the system so I didn't need to give my address.  That's always nice.

For our pizzas we ordered the 1st one extra sauce, light cheese, ricotta and meatballs for the toppings.  That exactly how it came to us - simply perfect!  The 2nd pizza was just a plain 'ole pepperoni.  I didn't have any of the pepperoni but everyone loved it.  The garlic knots were a little tough so they were just ok and the marinara sauce it came with was very good..

Now I've recently gotten the pizza bug and I've never really been into pizza.  They say your tastebuds change every 7 years....so I guess this is my tastebud change. haha So with that I must say I've frequent many pizza places over the last few months and I have to say that the meatball pizza with the ricotta was a very CLOSE SECOND to my favorite woodfired pizza at Novacento.  Oohmygeerrrd it was so good!  I must have this again and soon!

People are always nice on the phone.  Our bill came to $37 (with coupon) including tip and I'm not sure if there was a delivery charge.  The delivery took about an hour to arrive which is pretty standard at dinner time.  I highly recommend North End.  Next time I MAY branch out and try something different but when you have something that perfect why order anything else?  ;)
As a Rhode Islander displaced to Las Vegas, this place made me feel at home. From the decor to the awesome northeast style pizza. I just found my go to pizza place. Thanks!
All I want to say is their dough is frozen. Seen the guy in the back taking out frozen dough. If I want frozen pizza I can go Smiths frozen section their pizza lot better hands down.

My tummy does not feel good.... :-(

We were stopping at Sam's Club in Centennial so I figured we would try North End.  All I've seen are good reviews on Yelp. It had to be good, right?

Not for me....

The guy at the counter was very nice.  I asked for a few minutes to figure out what my husband and I wanted. We decided on a medium Supreme pizza (pepperoni, green peppers, mushrooms, onions and sausge), macaroni and cheese bites and garlic knots.  We asked for the garlic knots and macaroni and cheese bites first, while the pizza was in the oven. The garlic knots were very heavy and doughy. Not light and fluffy like we usually get at our other favorite pizza spots. The macaroni and cheese bites were ok.  My son liked them so that was a plus. When he brought out the pizza, it did not look appetizing at all. I really don't know how to describe it. We ate it anyway. Well, here were are two hours later.  I've got a stomachache and my hubby is sitting next to me shelling pistachios because he's hungry. I wish I would have just had a couple hot dogs at Sam's Club instead.

I like to support local business, but unfortunately I won't be able to give this one a good review. We ordered the Hawaiian pizza with extra meatballs because really, how can you mess that up.  It was a family consensus that it was the worst pizza ever.  I called and told the owner that it was not good. I also made it clear I wasn't looking for a refund just wanted my feedback to help them keep future business.  He wasn't interested and defended his pizza.  So sad, with an ego like that I hope they stay in business.

A lil on the pricey side.. $2.50 for each extra topping will run the tab up fast... pizza was great!! New York flavor at its best but the wings? No bueno and the fries were bad... no seasoning and slightly under cooked. Delievery service was cool. I'll just stick with the pizza on my next run

Pizza was pretty good. Not quite 4 or 5 star worthy as some of these other posts would lead you to believe. I might have given up a 4th star if my garlic knots hadn't tasted like they were made yesterday. I saw a big bowl of them sitting behind the counter. Very chewy, heavy and if you squeeze them oil drips out. I will probably go back because it is close to home, but only for the pizza.

Me and my sister visit North End tonight . 
The pizza was delicious , eggplant parm pasta and wing were really good too . Real east coast pizza , cheesy with the right amount of pizza sauce and home made dough . The interior is all Boston design and the Three flat TVs are great for a football and baseball games . The customer service was fast and friendly .
I definitely will return and I recommend it to all of you in Yelp !

Great pizza!! Everything about it makes my tastebuds dance! Huge slices, thin crust, tasty bread and toppings.  Save room for dessert, go for some italian ice- its similar to a snow cone but 10 times better.  I like blue raspberry.  The service is fast and friendly. This is not your average pizza hut/papa johns joint... It blows places like that out of the water!!  I'm definitely going to be a regular here! It's in a new strip mall located near Durango/Centennial Center blvd, near 7 eleven.

Walking in, you can immediately see its a lunch atmosphere more than dinner. It's a wonderful boston, new York City flare on Italian food. I had a meatball calzone while the bf had the Philly cheese steak. Both were absolutely superb and very large. If you are getting the calzone. Make sure you have someone to share it with! Our dessert was the fried dough...it's what made it 5 stars. The fried dough made us both almost collapse in doughy goodness, perfectly made! We are coming back asap.

North End Pizza...YUM!  One of the first pizza places Ive found that will actually deliver to my house in BFE & Im happy to report excellent pizza & nice delivery guy who got here well before the estimated delivery time!  Highly recommend!

I've ordered takeout from them several times and it's always delicious. We always get white pizza and it's SO SO SO good here. I'm not usually into white pizza but what they make is spectacular. I'm not into their garlic knots though - to be honest, it just seemed like bread to me. Delivery is prompt & good.
Pizza good. Salad good. Music playing sucks! We also expected/hoped for a beer...but apparently don't serve it anymore. I suggest order out.

We got a groupon for this place and tried the place out. I have tried famous Mystic Pizza in Connecticut, this place is almost as good. I would say this is the best in Vegas. Everytime I crave pizza, I go here. My favorite is the white pizza with extra egg plant topping. Garlic chips is abit salty for my taste.
We love the white pizza with spinach ~ good calzones too. Ok pasta ~ wish they had angel hair :) Always friendly staff eat-in or delivery.

I ordered the steak and cheese sub. It had no cheese. The caprese salad says it has olive oil and salt and pepper. It didn't have of them. I added additional toppings on my pizza and they were left off. I ordered two side of ranch and they were missing as well. Disappointed because of the issues and the food wasn't even good. Won't be ordering from here anymore.
Really good pizza! Thin, crispy crust, hot and yummy! Had the veggie and it didn't disappoint.  Atmosphere is good with Sinatra playing in the background.  Would make a special trip to come back!!

I'm really hurt. Came for lunch with coworkers after they raced on about it, and I knew this was it. Then I ordered for delivery. The pizza was cold with no warmth, a hair was in it (no it was not cheese). When I called to simply at least let them know about the hair, they said they'd call back. I got a call back but I missed it and when I returned the call I gave them the benefit of the doubt given its Friday and still no call back. :( sad to say it didn't work between us.

Wow!!! Evo perfection!!! I passed this place so much I told my husband I want to try it. I'm a picky person and the service plus the food man!! ********** Lots of stars 2 slices of cheese pizza and a drink $5.99 I thought to myself ok cool ordered that and Garlic knots 6 for $3.99. I get home and open the box and #BAM this was like 4 slices!!! The garlic knots were pretty and tasty! It was definitely worth the money I will be back, hell I have lunch for tomorrow!

Zero Stars!would be the best review! 
We too have been customers of this pizza joint for years but had not ordered here in months. Recently we ordered pizza and wings. So disappointed!!! Wings were not crispy and with sauce and soaked in greasy goo in the to go container,which we asked for extra crispy and sauce on the side  :(
The pizza was not what we remembered. I called establishment,# 1 whoever answered didn't give a crap about my concerns then #2 another guy gets on phone stating he is the owner and that they are same owners & recipes etc. from always.... LIAR! From reading recent reviews it has all changed but the name so sad they have tarnished this establishments name. Anyways the douch bag that answered had no apologies,no concern and not even an offer to make it right! Save your monies people this place is DISGUSTING and a disgrace to pizza!

We will never order from here again, first the guy who took our order literally took his time with our order, I was very cleared about my order and double checked and he even repeated the order back to me... It was simple we ordered two small pizzas wanted it extra crispy a salad and blue cheese.... Pizza was not crispy at all, not the salad we wanted and no blue cheese.... I called and told the guy about the order and went un oh, let me talk to my manager, returns and says he will have the correct salad be redelivered.... I told them it's okay how about just giving us a refund? Well that was not happening... Cause their system does not give refunds... Then he said we couldn't make your pizza crispy cause it will burn.... We put it in our oven for an extra 6 min and it was crispy and did not burn.... Overall I'm don't recommend this joint

We did a search for the best pizza in Vegas, and found this place the most. About 20 minutes from the strip, but well worth the drive. Pizza was amazing! Thin crust, cheese a plenty and the feta and bacon toppings were fabulous. Glad we chose this one on our vacation! You should too!

Im so picky but everything I tried here was so so so tasty...Maybe cause all food is homemade- potato chips, garlic knots with homemade marinara... Antipasto salad with homemade creamy Italian dressing ....yummy...

3 stars because the food is good. Cant say much for the management. Very rude. They forget your side items and do nothing to make it better. No offer of discount later or even an apology. Probable wont return as a customer.

I finally stopped by this place...and...this is the BEST pizzeria in las vegas!!! I  was told they spend more money just to ship the dough from the east coast and the pizza tastes authentic. I really like their meat lovers pizza and wings.  Great quality food and customer service was phenomenal. Although,  I wish there were more specials as I didn't have any coupons with me (apparently they send out), but you NEED to give this place a try.

The original owner sold it and the place has slipped quite a bit. She was always there and that made the difference. Still decent pie but not great. They changed the gravy on the meatballs and it is way too sweet now. It might be from a can.  
I would not avoid it but it has fallen from its previous stellar heights.

Worst customer service EVER!!!! I had gotten a flyer in the mail on 5/28 and was excited to try this place after all the great reviews. On the flyer they advertise that they close at 9:00pm I called at 8:00 pm and was told by a very rude gentleman that they were closing early because they were "dead" when I asked to speak to a manager ( because I thought that it was false advertisement that they were closing an hour earlier than what was advertised ) I was told that that " the manager wasn't there" and it wasn't his problem since he "didn't make the advertisements". I will NEVER order food from this place just because of their customer service.
I have been here three times. One of my favorite pizza joints in Las Vegas. I always get the pepperoni pizza and the calzone. Either the meat lovers or italian calzone. Love this place.

North End is the closest to my house as far as family owned pizza/fast food places that deliver are concerned, and boy am I glad that they are.  You can't go wrong with any of their food.  My boyfriend and I have had a few different pizzas with different toppings, but you can't go wrong with their good old cheese, which they run a ValPak coupon for a large at only $9.99, and even if you forgot it/don't have it, usually if we mention it, they still hook us up.

My boyfriend loves their hot chicken tenders and we both love their fried zucchini sticks, as well as my friends who I've taken North End to.  I will be very sad when I move across town and have to find something else- hopefully North End is doing well enough that they will be able to expand... =]
Totally gone down hill since it changed ownership. The help is very rude on the phone and the pizza isnt the same. We won't be back.
The food is good.  I had the hawaiian specialty pizza.  If you want a different pizza joint to try, try ordering from North End Pizza.

SO. #%$&ing. GOOD. 
AUTHENTIC, Real. Genuine, in an artificial city full of hoodwinking fakes. Delicious and homemade, unlike all of their competition. Am I connected to them? No, I'm connected to the TRUTH: do yourself a favor and eat this pizza before you die and waste your life.
I was really, really surprised after reading all the glowing reviews about this place.  Really sub-standard.  The pepperoni was extremely greasy.  Overall pretty tasteless.  I will not go back.

We got pepperoni pizza and it was good. However,  the sides we got we're less than desirable.  We ordered the mozzarella sticks, garlic knots and fried dough. The mozzarella was completely solid inside and not melted at all, the garlic knots were hard and could be used as hockey pucks and the fried dough was so greasy that it was sitting in a puddle of grease in the Styrofoam container, I couldn't even taste the powder sugar or the cinnamon.  What made everything rude was how I was treated when I called to complain.  I was told there was no manager on duty, the guy on the phone made excuses for everything and said there was nothing wrong with anything and that he liked all of the items I complained about, then didn't offer to fix the situation, he just hung up. Very disappointed.
It's nothing outstanding, and that is exactly why I like it. Simple, fresh, thin-crust pizza. Clean tasting sauce & a nice chewy crust. I think North End will be our new go-to for pizza.

Got a cheese pizza, calzone and chicken caesar salad and i hate to say but everything was less than average. The salad didnt fill the container and barely had any chicken. The cheese pizza didn't have any flavor and the cheese didnt cover the pizza

Great NY style thin pizza in the middle of the desert.  I grew up eating NY pizza so I can say it's comparable to NY and better than most LA pizza places.  I'm a purist so I always get the plain cheese.  The sauce is flavorful and the crust is just right.  Also friendly service.

Let me be blunt!! This little place is one of a kind in its pizzas, Pastas, meatball sandwiches and more Italian foods because of their authentic taste!! I'm Italian and very hard to please and because of that, I generally don't go to Italian restaurants because of disappointment.  Their Italian bread is to dye for along with everything else! What I have learned over time is, Huge and fancy restaurants does not mean the food is appealing or authentic in quality. It's the little small businesses that work to be the best

I've been eating here consistently pretty much once a month for the past year and I haven't been disappointed once.  I've tried the chicken tenders, garlic chips, Italian wedding soup and their house salad when I'm trying to "balance" the meal, but mostly, I go there when I'm craving their fantastic thin crust pizza.  I don't get anything fancy.... just a couple slices of cheese pizza.

Picture the bite:  Perfectly chewy, crusty with just the right amount of char on the bottom + tangy sweet tomato sauce + ooey gooey cheese + grease.

Tip:  I stress again that this is NOT for the greasy food haters.  Just don't step into there.  Just don't.

Conclusion:  What are you waiting for?!  Go get some pizza!

Poor customer service. The delivery girl was over 30min late from a already 45min wait window. Fries were stale and hard. Called in "nothing" they can do. Who serves up crappy food and allows it to go out the door! No thanks. Not ordering here again.

This place gets a 1 star each for the good philly cheese steak and the delivery girl..other than that it's garbage. We ordered fries that came extremely stale and burnt. We called to complain and they said they couldn't do anything about it. Really? Real bad customer service. Won't be ordering from here again.

$65 bucks for a large supreme pie, 6 "garlic knots" that were mini garlic biscuits, cheese steak sandwich, 3 canoli's and 10 wings and couldn't even throw in a complimentary $2 2-liter pepsi um yea...wont be back. I have no problem spending for food but for mediocre food from a local pizzeria? No thanks. Take me to Verrazano Pizza or Dom Demarco's and paid maybe $10 less and gotten tastier food.

The crust is where it's at and the service is pretty good too. The atmosphere feels like a family run place and you can tell they have their share of regulars. I have say we are one of them. Good food, good service, a winner.

Very bland from the new owners. Old owners would not let the pizza out the door unless  it was right. Old wait for a pie was 1/2 hr to 45 minutes now only 15 minutes and not a great pie.
Asked for a sausage pizza and received very little of it. Not great sausage either with not much taste. Try Pepperoni maybe but stay away from the sausage. Wings were undercooked and Hot flavor was not there either.
Staying away from this place and go back to Metro or even Hungry Charles.
Pizza was pretty good, but didn't stand out in any particular area.  We ordered for pickup and it was ready when we arrived.  Friendly staff.  No disappointments.

Good NY style pizza. Good wings too. Large three topping pizza, ten piece order of wings, & four Blue Moons came to $42. Not bad.  Friendly staff, nice cozy (small) setting in new development just off 215/Durango northwest.  We will go back.

I came here at least once a week at one point in time and now I just refuse to do so. It's not the same quality of food. It's like they have new chefs or owners. It's not the same friendly faces I used to see. Their pizza is just alright, you're probably better off going to the dominos across the street though. Better yet, the calzones now, which were my favorite at one point, aren't worth coming in for. And the cherry on top goes to the cannolis. Absolutely terrible.

Wish I could give 10 stars- that is how good the pizza is! The crust is crispy, the oil drips down. Not soggy (like some places I have been too!) . Definitely recommend. Have lunch specials - staff is courteous and friendly.

We ordered some snacks from them because we were having a lazy night.. I was thrilled that they delivered all the way out to us! We ordered macaroni bites, garlic knots, and mozzarella sticks.. Macaroni bites, delicious! Garlic knots, delicious! And oh my goodness the mozzarella sticks are amazing! Can't wait to order pizza from here!

Food was awesome. Took a little longer than expected but everything was really good. Only reason for loss of a star is that it isn't the cleanest place (I would still return) and they had the music on AND the TV blaring a football game. Pick one. Not both. Two good size tv's for such a small place and can see the screens from about anywhere. Pizza and pasta were good, good servings sizes (very large) and easy going place.

My family has been eating north end pizza for over a year and a half.
Granted the finished product is a bit expensive but overall it's been a good pie until recently. My last 3 out of 5 orders have either come soggy cold or soggy and cold and/or delivered by a dope smoking teenager hitting on my daughter in my driveway. After attempting to speak with a manager for 2 days I was rebuffed by som recalcitrant teen twit and put off and lied to; spoken to rudely and treated with less than honorable intentions by North End pizza staff... I really dont care how good you think you are... but with people like this,  I feel its an obligation to take them down to decency.
You want a average to good pizza delivered God knows when and  in what condition by who knows what sort of individual ?.... By all means order from these clowns.
Mediocre food and service with 'no smile'.  Price was pretty low for the subs, but there isn't much to say for the flavor.
Good guys, decent thin crust slices, total east coast vibe. Not bad in North West Vegas
I love North End. The white pizza is incredible. It seems like the prices have gone up significantly since their opening but I must say, you get what you pay for!

Yummy! I ordered delivery on New Years,  and it got to my house in about 45 minutes (which is what the app estimated) and I got an eggplant parmesan sub and macaroni and cheese bites. 
Sub: The flavor was really good. I could put their marinara sauce on a shoe and still love it. The eggplant was pretty soggy by the time it got to my house,  which was to be excepted, that's what I get for getting something breaded on a sub delivered,  but as I said the flavor was still really good. 
Macaroni and cheese bites: Probably one of my new favorite snacks, they were nice and hot and crispy,  and I got a ton for $3.75 
Can't wait to try the pizza!

Was here a couple times about a year ago and pizza was good , but recently in past month ordered pizza again and prices are higher than I remember. Pizza not as good as I remember. What has changed ?!

The staff was friendly but the pizza was meh at best.  For the prices they charge, you would think they could afford nicer plates, napkins, and some real pizza stands.  The owner showed up, parked in a spot that wasn't a parking spot and then sat staring at my family wait we ate.

HORRIBLE.  First time customer and LAST TIME.  I just got one of the saddest worst pizza's I've gotten in long memory.  I just moved from SoCal, I know good pizza.  Getting a frozen pizza from the store would have been more tantalizing to the look and taste buds.

They said 45 mins, came in 50+ and pretty much cold.  I was supposed to get their signature pie North End.  Its super thin, little sauce and cheese and wheres the meat?  I asked her for something "meaty."  

This pizza needs to go on the Wall of Shame and I'm writing the manager through Yelp to request a refund.  Whoever runs this pizza needs to go eat some REAL pizzas and get a grip.  This pizza is shameful.

I was trying to figure out why their reviews are all over the place.  NO ONE could think this pizza is great.  They must be putting up Shill Buyer reviews
Great pizza with quality toppings amd cheese. You can taste the difference. The family loved it. The canoli's were ok, might pass on those next time. We will definately order pizza from here again.

Ordered vegetarian with sausage added...was told this was the same as deluxe....but deluxe apparently has pepperoni, which we didn't want (grease issues) and no olives, which we did want..So no, it's not the same....Pointed that out to the guy who took the order when the pizza came and he stammered and said, "That's what I was told" as he quickly scanned the menu description...he said he was sorry and it wouldn't happen again but offered no discount or coupons or anything "customer service" related...Last time at North End

Have ate at this place and can honestly say it is definitely not the best pizza I've ever had I mean it's edible depending on if you like your crust burnt and the bread greasy. The management could also use some work unfortunately when I went there they seemed quick to get you out and leave I told the lady that the pizza seemed old and she gave me a eye roll and got me a new slice now treat your customers better or you might just go out of business
I'd been wanting to try this place as I'd just moved to the area.  The positive reviews had me intrigued.  The pizza was disappointing, tasted like hamburger on top of card board

Not my favorite...we ordered from here because it was a Sunday and Mr. Jim's was closed which is our go to just because it is so close.  We looked on yelp to find another pizza delivery place that wasn't a national chain that was in our area and saw that this place delivered and didn't look to bad.  We were pretty disappointing when our pizza arrived lukewarm after taking forever.  The pizza may have been good when it was hot and fresh, but unfortunately by the time it arrived this was not the case.  We may try it again and see if this was just a bad night for them.

Found this place on Yelp and my friend was excited because he's from Boston. We don't live anywhere near here but decided to try it out because Bostonians are very loyal to other Bostonians... LOL

We came here on a Friday night. This place is very busy; there weren't enough tables to seat all of the guests. We waited about a half hour for a cheese pizza that tasted exactly like the pizza from Bambinos - another Boston pizzeria - which is much closer to home. *shrugs*

Very expensive and not very good. When I called to place an order the person on the phone was arguing with another person and barely payed attention to my order. My order came wrong and almost 2 hours late!!!

This place is the worst. Our normal pizza place, Above the Crust was slammed and had a 2 hour delivery so we tried here. Biggest mistake ever, paid over $40 for 2 pies and a bottle of soda!! They dont tell you on the phone your total, now I know why! It wasnt until the driver came and I really thought he had someone elses receipt! If the pizza was incredible I wouldnt have mind but it was NOTHING special! 

Now after seeing an employee slamming a customer, calling her fat and her daughter. Disgusting. I really hope people do the right, take a stand against this kind of behavior and boycott North End!!
One of my favorite pizza places. Great sauce and great crust. Love the supreme pizza. Even delivered it was great.

If ZERO stars was an option this establishment would definitely receive a ZERO. Let's start off by stating the facts DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!! Save your money and do yourself a favor and STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS PLACE!! What they consider food is disgusting.... The way they serve their food and how they allow the items to be sent out from the kitchen like this is a disgrace!!!!!! Don't let me forget to mention the management or lack of!!!!! When I spoke to the manager about the slop they call food and how the food was undercooked, stale and tasted like cardboard the manager was useless and showed ZERO empathy and did not even acknowledge the concerns. I AM NOT GOING BACK HERE AGAIN!!!!! WHAT A WASTE YOU CANNOT HAVE HORRIBLE MANAGEMENT AND HORRIBLE FOOD AND SURVIVE IN THIS TOWN.   GOOD RIDDANCE!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Pizza was delicious. I love the fact that its not drenching in marinara sauce. The garlic knots was ok. It didnt have enough garlic flavor or butter.  Service was great though. We do plan on ordering from them for delivery. Theres 3 tvs in the restaurant. Great during football season.

The food is great, the service is a bad joke!  Don't try to get it delivered and don't go through EAT24 either. 3 miserable experiences and zero help from the restaurant. Tonight (after an hour and a half wait) will be my last time ordering from them!

One of the best pizzeria restaurants! Cheese pizza was delish....thin crust, New York style! You have to try the garlic knots! Interior was Boston style w lots of Boston decor. Customer service was over the top!

The food is ok HOWEVER my husband started choking while eating his sandwich. I dislodged a piece of tape from his throat. I called to let them know and they didn't seem to care. Just because of that I will no longer order from them. If we received an apology of some sort then cool, we understand accidents happen.

One of our favorite pizza spots in the area, thin crust with a delicious flavor. We've only every ordered not sure how the location is in person but I would definitely suggest this place if your looking for something new to try out.

DO NOT SUPPORT !


Worst pizza place I have ever been to. Owner literally called my grandson a faggot while we were there!!! I have no idea how this place is allowed to stay open. Homophobic and just plain rude owner and management. I have also seen it on the news for calling another women  a fat-ass. I have reported it multiple times but no one has done anything. I have also been informed of its poor treatment of their employees. On top of all of that the pizza is lackluster. 

I would rather go to LITERALLY ANY OTHER PIZZA PLACE that is not insanely racist, rude, and overall shitty. Please stop giving this place your business so it will close for good.

Great pizza just like back east. Everything from the sauce, the crust, and the toppings are completely fresh. They have wonderful service. The only reason I gave them 4 stars and not 5 is because a lot of the time through delivery, the pizza is always lukewarm  and not hot. Nothing an oven could fix but oh well.

Wow after reading Daniel S. review of NEP well I just had to have some. So I got a large extra cheese on my half and the husband has some mess on his half like bacon peperoni and something else. Call me selfish & spoiled if you will. But this pizza is so good that I was mad at my husband for wanting his half. 
YOU READ CORRECT: It was so pretty and cheesy I simply didn't want him touching my pizza or breathing my air for that matter. I don't know maybe I had some girl moment or something but my husband had been at work all day and somehow I wished he could just go back to his office at city hall and leave me alone with the pizza. So I could watch cartoons and eat pizza ALONE with out him at all.
 He was just all in my space looking hungry and eating his half of the pizza. Pfff he don't even like pizza but yet here he is all in my box getting slice after slice munching talking bout...this is some good pizza. I'm glad your on yelp and you found this pizza. See you guys don't get to feel pity for him either because truth is he don't like yelp he says yelp takes my attention from him and that I check in all the time and give tips. Anyway did I say I wanted to slap him silly for opening my box of pizza? Next time he will get his own pizza. I'm not sharing my North End Pizza its to hot & good. No. He cant ever have any at all. ..........Pfffff

Having moved here from the east coast I can honestly say that this pizza is the closest to northeastern Boston style pizza you'll find. It is on the greasy side and it delicious.  Be advised, the delivery service is poor and takes a long time. You'll be better served to get carry out.  That aside, if you like northern style pizza this is a must try place!
We love this place! Great slices, service is always with a smile, and the prices are reasonable...If you love east coast pizza, this is the place. The crust is to die for.
I've only tried their 2 slice and a drink combo for $6 but so far so good! The slices are huge and the people are friendly I highly recommend

For anyone reading these reviews you will notice a couple of trends..... one being customer service and the second being chewy and /or tough dough. I would like to focus particularly on customer service as this was the straw that broke the camels back and while we will not be returning to North End Pizza. EVER. I can't even say bad customer service because there isn't any. Never should anyone have to wait at the counter for over 3 minutes with people behind the counter and not even be acknowledged. I had a pick up order that I placed and paid for online. Upon arrival all 3 people behind the counter could not even look up or say hi. After patiently waiting the 3 minutes, which seemed like a life time, I finally said that I was there for a pick up. The gentleman told me he would be there in a minute and continued to cut sheets of dough as I watch my food sitting packaged and ready to go slowly getting cold. Now I can understand having to wait a minute but at least acknowledge your CUSTOMERS and not be rude and dismissive when making them wait while you finish your prep work. I'm not sure why the dough cutting couldn't be paused for the 30 seconds it would take to say hi, grab my order and say thank you. I have experienced a less than friendly environment there in the past and it is not worth my money for terrible service, inadequate attention and what I will now deem mediocre food. DONE.
This is a solid pizza joint, you will get quality every time. On top of that the crew seems to be family and they are very nice.

I literally just got done downing 3 pieces and although it had left me full and satisfied the only thing I could think of while I was eating it was that it was just OK.  I really really wanted to like it, however I felt that the ingredients were just mediocre and just a step up above average.  I ordered a large pizza with pepperoni, sausage, mushroom and ricotta cheese.  One thing that I truly loved about this pie was the crust.  The bottom of the pizza had a nice char on it which prevented the slice from becoming soggy and droopy. Again, this place was just OK.  

If you're looking for a better pizza place in the northwest I would strongly suggest Marc Riches.
We love North End!!!! Best people.... and perfect family environment!!!! Keep it going!!!

I ordered a extra large pizza tonight hoping for the best price was high but still hopeful.....then the problems started.  

First off delivery was supposed to take 45 mins and knock on the door was 90 mins after order was placed, double the estimated time....now today at delivery time it was still 103 outside but pizza was cold...so much so the cheese was a solid mass....half was hamburger and meat was thrown ON TOP OF THE CHEESE.  Soooooo, naturally when it was cooked the hamburger turned into lumps of charcoal.....

So we called and talked to manager Ivo who offered to send another pizza.....yeah because I want another pizza like this in about two hours??   Oh hell no!  Manager, finally, despite it being clear there was a language barrier and much yelling on our part and an offer to return pizza to restaurant agrees to refund the cost of pizza....then I get to thinking....I paid online thru Grubhub how the hell can he refund me?   

So call Grubhub whose rep apologizes profusely and confirms refund would have to come from them not the restaurant but he would be happy to call and confirm our saga....and Ivo promptly tells him he will not authorize a refund only send out another pizza....and this after he said he would refund after we offered to bring him back the pizza we had and he said no he would take it off my card.....SO HE OUTRIGHT LIED TO US!   To give credit Grubhub rep was great and did give us $10 coupon which is all he could do with manager now refusing to authorize a refund...

I will never ever do business with this place again -AWFUL FOOD, HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE AND MANAGER IS AN OUTRIGHT LIAR!!

Found this place by word of mouth. So glad we tried it. The pizza is   The best!!  it's exactly like a true  Brooklyn NY Pie!! Living in Las Vegas 20 years and this is by far the best I have had .. Thank You Evo  for bringing NY to me....we will be back ...
Great cheese pizza. Your local neighborhood pizzeria with great pizza is what you really want. I have found my neighborhood pizzeria favorite place.

I ordered directly through the yelp app for delivery and paid using my pay pal. It was very convenient and easy to use. I requested parmesean cheese to be delivered and that was not included ( minor detail, but a pet peeve of mine) I ask for extra cheese on one pizza and I could not tell anything extra was added. I am a cheese lover when I order pizza I prefer heavy cheese. On the second pizza we added pepperoni and sausage ( no extra cheese). The pep and sausage added made the pizza not seem like there was no cheese at all.  Both pizzas were very soggy. When the pizza person delivered they were extremely rude. Myself and my 12 year old sons were at the door during the delivery.  I asked for change to leave a cash tip. He asked me how much tip. I had $1.00 cash on me. I would be leaving a total ($4) and he rudely told me to keep my change as he walked away.   I was completely confused and embarrased.  I will not be ordering from here again. I really wanted to like this place.
I love this pizza place! Great pizza and reasonably priced. Every time I have a craving for pizza I go to North End.

If I could give this dump zero stars then I would. The absolute worst pizza I've ever had. Soggy, cold, no flavor. Service was despicable! Avoid this place like the plague. Years ago we came to this place and it was great, I wonder if they got new owners. Such a shame. I'll never be back
This is one of my favorite places for pizza in town food is aways warm and tasty the delivery aways on time  I recommend this place for anyone that's looking for good pizza.

This was our first time eating here (delivery) and we weren't disappointed. Delivery was within an hour and the pizza was original. We will be ordering delivery again

We ordered again the white pizza and ckn wings. Food was just as good this time around
Idk what's worse... their soggy pizza or their staff. Learn how to be professional grown ups.

I stopped here on the way home from work. I was feeling like a good pizza. This was pretty much up my alley when it comes to pizza. The crust was fantastic. Very cheesy! And they didn't skimp me on the pepperoni. I was happy. I also had the garlic knots that i didn't care for (doughy) but my girlfriend ate the entire order so they had to be good! lol 

I will most likely be back.
Decent pizza, not great. But delivery guy didn't bring paper plates and napkins as requested and two large pies were $51 plus tip. Not worth it in the end.
We loved the white pizza and red sauce pepperoni.   So much cheese and fresh ingredients.   The only reason I didn't give 5 starts is that it came to us a hr and twenty minutes after and was cold.
The pizza is definately the best in vegas! very good deals, and service is fast and friendly! everything you could want in a restaurant! go try it!

I was looking forward to eating here based on the other reviews.
I was a little disappointed though.  Their pizza is just okay, nothing great.
It's not worth the drive from the strip, but I might go back again only if I'm in the area.

This fucking place sucks I don't know what New York Pizza taste like but I'm pretty sure this shit isn't it, so disgusting and nasty... so I order a extra large pizza which was $25 and it comes with barely no cheese on it like who the hell orders pizza with no cheese on it so I called to complain and the fucking owner gets on the phone with his rude ass and tells me oh we're trying to save on cheese and we don't do refunds I don't want a refund idiot I want a pizza with cheese on it will if this is your first time here and you go toa place if you don't like it just don't come back oh my gosh at that point I wanted to grab my gun and go shoot his ass in the head so he tells me well you're going to have to bring it back and we'll throw it in the oven and throw some cheese on it like what the fuck... Do not go to this joke of a place

So disappointed. Been a long time customer of North End Pizza, too. I only like East Coast New England Style Pizza and once upon a time North End was an answer to a pizza prayer. Once upon a time (as I recall) the dough was even flown in from Boston. Not. Any. More. 
Ordered my typical order of cheese pizza tonight and it was...gross. 
Hard to chew cardboard dough, bland sauce and what little cheese there was was NOT the traditional 4+ cheese blend. What the heck happened to this place?! Must be under new ownership. Don't bother!  Blech.
The pizza is some of the best in Vegas. Great east coast style. Since Evo left the management has been superb. Keep making great pizza.

Have my wife's urging I went back and tried this place again. This time I ordered a pizza. 

It was a pretty good pie.  I guess I will stick to the pizzas here.
North End may be the best New York/Boston style pizza in the Northwest part of VEGAS. I absolutely LOVE IT!!

Can't even believe the response I just got back from this place. As a business you probably shouldn't talk down to your customers. Word of mouth is the best way to attract more guests aside from actually having good food and I'll definitely be telling all of my friends and family about the reaction I got for my review. The owner was so sweet and looked like they were a bit understaffed or just had a rush but he was still courteous. I got the lunch special with two slices of pizza. They are big slices but thin and I loved the crust. It was crunchy but just the right blend of sauce and cheese. If you pay down your pizza with paper towels, the grease isn't so bad. Great deal for less than $7 if you have time to dine in. Definitely top of my list for pizza places when I come back again to visit Vegas. Got my pizza super quick too. Only complaint is it's kinda warm in here but I assume since it's a pizza place they got HOT ovens. I didn't mind too much.

First time ordering here. Took about 50 minutes for delivery and the pizza arrived semi-warm, not hot. Pizza was average quality, nothing special for a $20 large pepperoni.  Garlic knots were small but OK.
Pizza was very good, excellent sandwiches as well, and very reasonably priced. Good service, will def go back again.
This used to be our favorite pizza & finger place. It's under new ownership and now it's not very good :(
Very bland dough. I had the calzone.. noo flavor.. the chicken dingers were great but they were prepaid. Coming from the east coast.. this was horrible.. but the staff and service was great

I went in on a sunday around 7:30pm. My girlfriend and I both ordered the 2 slice special with a drink. we paid like $11 bucks. Slices came out fresh, huge and really delicious it reminded me of the slices I used to get in Chicago. I will come back and grab a pie with the rest of my family.

I go here for lunch 2-3 times a month.  Love the pizza.  I've seen the negative reviews on Yelp but have never been treated badly by the employees.   Always good food and good service for me.  The only negative thing is the Boston decor (I'm a New Yorker). :)
I really enjoy northend pizza. I live close by so they're convenient REAL pizza. There delivery is fast and friendly and their dine in specials are great. The white pizza is amazing.

We've been going here for 10+ years,  and it has sadly gone down hill over we the past couple years.  We just had a pizza and spaghetti and meatballs  delivered, and both were just terrible.  We called and spoke to someone regarding our disappointment, and were offered a measly 10% off our next purchase.  There won't be a next purchase.  $40 waisted, only to turn around and call Capriottis for a new meal. Bye North End.  It was better with the previous owner.
Pretty much our favorite pizza place and they deliver! Great service, can't complain.

HORRIBLE BUSINESS. Sink this ship...it deserves to CLOSE

There are many fake Yelp accounts giving this business 5 star reviews, I assume in an attempt to offset his sinking business. 

After all the "Compliments" used to threaten and bully anyone giving less than stellar reviews, how is this man still paying his bills??? These complements are all visible to the public and the more I look, the more I read and become disgusted. Not only should this place be out of business, but IVO (The Bulgarian owner) should be jailed and returned to his country. We don't need his behavior here. He bashes "Americans" on Yelp and to his employees. The baseball bat behind the counter and calling his teenage employees "bitches" is just some of the incredibly sickening things he gets away with daily. 

The Health dept needs to investigate this businesses habit of leaving food in the pots all shift and then placing the food in the fridge and back to the stove the next day. NOT GOOD! When a kid that's had the Health Card mentions how the food needs to be stored and handled other ways, he was called a "bitch". Even if their food was TOP NOTCH, I would never support this lack of respect by any business towards their help!
