My goodness, where to start? The pizza was beyond disappointing. I ordered the white pizza and it had no flavor! The pizza dough was tough and tasted like a saltine cracker. I didn't see any spinach or the mushrooms that I ordered. I ordered the North End Pizza and expected meat, what meat? I was so embarrassed in front of the people of my get together, they didn't even finish their slices. They asked me if it was real meat or some vegan "fake" meat pizza. 

Upon calling the manager he only said, "Sorry, we will make it better for you next time," and hung up 

Next time? No way! I spent over $50 for some tasteless, hard crust, disappointing pizza. Sad!

First time trying North End Pizza.  It was very good thin crust, hot and fresh and very reasonably priced.  Love the decor but of course I'm a Boston fan and there is lots of Boston memorabilia along with the Rat Pack and Mafia motif.   The pizza is familiar and is reminiscent of Villa pizza  in the mall  but still delicious.

I LOVE this place. I spent my formative years in Germany. There was a little place in our village called Pinocchio's Pizzeria. It was run by a family straight from Italy. I adored that place and had never had better pizza before or since. North End Pizza is the closest I've come to Pinocchio's. The crust is super thin. The sauce is perfect. I have no idea how to describe the sauce. I've tried for years to describe how PInocchio's sauce was different than anything else you can find. Well, North End Pizza has the sauce I'm talking about. Delicious! 

My husband loves their french fries, of all things! He also gives a thumbs up to their garlic knots. They serve fried zucchini spears and those are really good too.

The service is outstanding. We've been twice now and had a great experience both times. The entire family loves the place.

I became aware of North End through work, as our boss decided to order a ton of pizzas for us at the end of a hard week. Pepperoni and cheese pizzas. They were pretty good, east coast style, with huge slices. 

Fast forward to just after Christmas, we stopped by to grab lunch. We both decided on the meat lover calzones with no ricotta, basically strombolis. I wish someone had told us how big these were, they were so huge that you could easily share them between 2 people. Half of one and we were both stuffed. 

We also got the garlic knots, which were absolutely perfect. Hot, not too greasy, with a delicious marinara sauce. 

Considering the cost, $12 for each calzone, this is a GREAT deal, as two people can just share. Grab a calzone, a small garlic knots, and you'll have a super delicious meal under $20. 

Note: credit card minimum of $4.
First time trying North End and I have to say it is now my favorite pizza place in town. We had the white pizza and Margherita - both were amazing!!! We will definitely be ordering again soon!!!!

I'm going to try and make this review somewhat short, sweet, and offensive because A - North End Pizza isn't worth my time reviewing and B - By the time you read this, the joint will probably be more closed than a virgin's legs at Christian camp. Okay; maybe it won't be THAT closed. But I don't anticipate North End Pizza being on the Food Network anytime soon either.

The major problem with North End Pizza is that I ordered a large cheese pizza (I'm broke, alright!) and they ran out of large boxes! What does this mean for me; the consumer? It means that I get my ONE large pizza spread out in EIGHT different sandwich bags each labeled 'sorry' with washable marker. Okay; I'm lying. But I would have preferred that over stacking the pieces on top of each other over two medium boxes leaving me with ten dollars of soggy, almost inedible cheese pizza! 

For the reason listed above, I can't really bring myself to pat North End Pizza on the back for ANYTHING! I hear some praise for the cleanliness of the place, but how hard is it to keep a restaurant clean when nobody is ever in it? The only reason this place doesn't get the distinct honor of being my first ONE star review is because I used to go to church. I feel bad for failing restaurants with a nice work crew.

You can listen to most of the other Harvard-graduate Yelpers on here and give North End Pizza a perfect review just because they play Cheatriot, I mean Patriot games. But let's be real about it. North End's Pizza is just like Boston, Massachusetts : Cheap and Characterless.

I will start off by saying I really enjoy the pizza and meatball subs from this place. I came into for take out because the delivery time from this place is always more than an hour after being told 30 mins. I always have to call back and ask where is my food. 

I am writing this review because I hate fake people. One of the employees today sat down with me and asked me about my tattoos and where and who. After some time of chatting this employee cuts it off and asks me to write a positive review about this place. I'm sorry that's not how this works. If I didn't like the pizza I wouldn't eat here. Obviously. Don't come up to me or people and talk to people and have them invest our time and then beg for a positive review. Doesn't work like that.

Always greeted by a friendly staff. Prices are reasonable. 2 huge slices and drink with free refills for $5.49.  Pizza is always hot and delicious. Been coming here for years.  I loved the previous owner though.

Amazing pizza, probably my favorite pizza place I've been to being in Vegas. Most pizza places are mediocre, in my opinion, but this place is one of the last standing that will always get my money. Love their pizza and garlic knots, and can't wait to go back soon! This place blows other nearby pizza restaurants (Blaze Pizza, Sammy's Woodfire Pizza, Dominoes, Pizza Hut, Mark Rich's...) out of the water! Keep it up Boston!

OMG. What a horrible rude douche that answered the phone. I didn't even get passed that, much less order a pizza. Why is this place still in biz? No customer service whatsoever. I'd rather go to Little Caesar's.
i ate some pizza from this place and it was too greasy and all around not very good ;/
Great place with nice people serving east coast style pizza! Husband and I enjoyed the Margherita pizza which was very good. Highly recommend if you're looking for east coast inspired pizza!

I have had this place bookmarked for a while and am glad we finally tried it. I felt like deep dish pizza and heard that North End puts out a good one. Walking inside we were greeted and told to sit anywhere. Looking around there were many pictures on the wall of movie posters and different sporting events as well family history of the owner and her family. A lot of Boston decor! The owner, Claudia, was there at a table not only eating, but saying hello to each customer and making sure they were enjoying their food. Claudia has her dad make the pizza dough at his restaurant in Boston, and then ships it to Las Vegas for use here at North End Pizza. Her mom makes the pizza sauce locally from her secret recipe.  

We started out with an order of "Garlic Knots" priced at $6.50 for an order of 12 knots and sauce. These weren't traditional since they were *not* in a *knot*, but more a disc if flavorless dough. With all of the seasoning on them, I didn't get it and would not order them again, knowing where I can get authentic ones at other restaurants in town. 

For the main course I ordered a "1/2 Ricotta & Garlic 1/2 Sausage Pizza" priced at  $22.99 including toppings. I ordered the Sicilian, which requires an hour for prep/bake time. If you know you want this then you can just call ahead and have them start it for you. The Sicilian only comes in 16 inch size. I really enjoyed this pizza! I tasted nothing but garlic on my half so I don't know where the garlic flavor was on the knots? The pizza dough was nice and thick and cooked thoroughly. We had more then enough left to take home for another meal! I want to come back and try their thin crust pizza next.

You can come in and buy pizza by the slice or try out some of their calzones, pasta, salads, sandwiches or appetizers. North End offers delivery/dine-in/carryout. 

Mon thru Sat: 11 am - 9 pm
Sun: 12 pm - 9 pm

I have only ordered twice from there....1st time order was correct pizza was OK at best however if you don't eat it right away( for example don't order a few pies for a party b/c they will sit out) it becomes cardboard. 

The second time (delivery) I ordered 20wings, side salad, and garlic knots. I got 10wings, a lady bug in my salad, and the knots were soggy. They wanted to charge me an additional delivery charge to bring me my correct order? Really? Save yourself the grief go somewhere else.

Wrost pizza! Extremely Expensive for what you get. Ordered pizza and was burned and they refused to make my family another one and make it right. Unprofessional management! Again bring your business somewhere else.

Just love this pizza place!!! Fresh dough from Boston, great quality pepperoni, yummy sauce!!!! The taste of the crust says it all!! The people who work there are also very nice and attentive. I also like the online coupon deal that keeps the price down a few dollars. Great way to keep us coming back!! Although their prices really are reasonable!! I take all my friends and family here when we want some great pizza!! And just when you though their pizza was so great, they also have other goodies available on the menu. We've had the wing and fry basket. Delicious and decently priced!! And to top it all off they are have beer by the bottle and blue moon available!!! Love this place and will be going back for a long time!!

Great place to grab a pie-crust is thin, chewy, and crispy at the same time, service is great, and the prices are reasonable...another favorite are their homemade garlic potato chips. At 75 cents for a basket, you can't go wrong with that. Definitely way better than the Doritos or Ruffles "Big Grab" bags which cost more and are half filled with air.

Definitely be back for more...I'm only 5 minutes away....ALOHA!!!

Great pizza. One of my top 3 in Vegas so far for this style of pizza and i have have been to id say at least 60% of the pizza restaurants in this city and still looking.  I cant vouch for anything else on the menu since i haven't tried anything else. I also would have to say their price is so-so for the pizza but i dont mind too much since i think its great Pizza.
 I have also been coming here since they opened and just read all the negative reviews. i havent seen any of the poor customer service or angry owner issues but i have seen the staff change quite a bit.
---Note.. that parking near the door has gotten terrible since the new bar opened but they do have underground parking for those who dont mind the walk.

I stopped by here last night.  I was craving a couple slices.  The customer service was excellant.  The surrounding was casual.  I would definately come back here, and the biggest reason why is cuz underneath where it  says "2 slices and a drink" was "2 slices and beer $7".  It's probably the best deal I've seen in any Boston pizza joint.
Great pizza place i go there every sunday .they. Have authentic boston pizza great food .affordable prices.if you havent gone you must go!!
Pizza is tasty, thin crust, although too much sauce for my preference.  Lots of menu choices. Did not like the garlic knots! But overall decent, clean and friendly.
Pizza tastes just like authentic New York Pizza. The fried zucchini is amazing! Our entire family loves everything here!

Gotta say these guys make a great pie!

But the service/management needs an attitude check. 

I am a former customer who would "carry out" from them once every 2 weeks or so for several months. I had a few bad experiences... A few times they told me 20 minutes until my order would be ready, I'd arrive 20-30 minutes later and it still wasn't ready. Which is fine! Company's get busy! I get it. And another time my order was taken over the phone, but they didn't actually make the pizza until I arrived and tried to pick it up. Again, while no offer was given for the loss of service, I still said nothing. Mistakes happen! We're all human!

Which brings us to today. I placed an order over the phone as usual. "20 minutes till it's ready." Standard, until I had an emergency that prevented me from going to get the pizza. I already felt bad calling to cancel my order, especially when they told me the pizza was already made. But there was no way I could get the pie. 1 employee had a non sympathetic tone before placing me on hold (without telling me) and another came on the line, whose voice I recognized as the manager, to say, "What am I going to do with the pizza?!" When I didn't have an answer he told me that he would put me on a list to no longer take orders from my phone number.  I said I'm sorry several times but it apparently wasn't enough. 

Bottom line, this is not an angry rant. But more an effort to leave feedback for a company that has room for growth! You lost a repeat customer tonight for the cost of a medium meat lovers pizza (roughly $20). Was it really worth it?!

If you're a fan of New York style pizza definitely check these guys out! But consider dining in :)

Had to change this revew to 1 star!!! I unfortunately tried to give them a 3rd chance. Shame on me. They still cant figure out how to take my order over the phone. They cut me off when I try to give them my number let alone my order and I have to continuously repeat myself. Not worth it. NEVER AGAIN!!!  


We ordered delivery twice now. The pizza was delicious both times however both times we ordered, it was a struggle. The people taking our order were distracted and seemed annoyed. The second delivery we asked for an order of wings and fingers with the pizza. When we got our delivery they were both fingers... slightly disappointment. Guess we won't order delivery again.

Amazing food. We tried out the pizza, the knots, and the fried macaroni and we loved it so much we came a few days later for the sandwiches, which were just as good. I really wasn't too impressed with the garlic knots, having other local places blow theirs out of the water. The macaroni bites were top class!!! We are going to be regulars here in the near future.
Great Food! Takes a little bit too long for your order sometimes! They could improve on that, but worth the wait!
This is my go to for good East Coast pizza. I've dined in and ordered out for pick up numerous times.  Consistently the same great quality. If you know good pizza you will not be disappointed!!!

I really enjoyed the fried Mac n Cheese and the Caprese salad. We also liked the pizza. This is likely a Yelp issue but delivery was a little slow. I really would like to try the pizza that they need an hour notice for. My takeaway is you probably want to do pickup and be aware of the portion sizes you are getting.

Good pizza and good fingers! What else can I say?! I've been here a few times and the quality is consistent. Friendly folks running the place too.

DO IT!

I used to love this place! Their calzones and White Pizza were my favs... I guess they must have sold the place because everything changed for the worse! Cheese tastes fake, dough had no pull/chew to it just a bread texture, the sauce... meh overall texture was just gross. Tried to reheat leftovers and it just stayed soggy and the cheese turned watery. And what tops it off ... they raised their prices while throwing quality and taste down the toilet. Well I can scratch this place off our list of "go-to" restaurants!

This pizza was soggy and bland. I called in my order, the lady on the phone told me it would be ready in 15-20mins. I stopped at the store grabbed a juice and headed over. Got there in exactly 20mins., by the time I got home and served up slices to my family, the pizza was soggy and flavorless, the Garlic Knots were hard and the chicken wings had so much fat on them, they obviously weren't cleaned and prepared properly. To top it off I did not receive a receipt and did not receive my proper change. I was so disappointed in this restaurant that I called to speak to a member of management. The woman I spoke with completely ignored my complaint, told me that next time I should ask for a crispier crust and that the $9 that I was shorted with change was inaccurate but since they did not give me a receipt I can't even fight it. So I thought I would warn others to their shady practices and terrible food.

So after a disastrous lunch @ Los Antojos, I had to redeem myself.  I read a few reviews about this place and it's near my end of town, so I decided to check it out on the way home from the office.

When I arrived there, I was shocked to see that the entire strip mall that this place is in was empty!  It was kind of Twilight Zonish creepy....I took pics, check it out....just weird.

Anyway, I walked in and was pleasantly surprised to see that it was spacious....I was expecting a small joint with a couple of tables.  I think the owners are from Boston....lots of Boston sports memorabilia on the walls.....and since it was dead, 3 of the workers were changing the channel to put on the Dodgers vs Red Sox game.  Cool!

I ordered the 2 Slices of Cheese Pizza special with a Bottle of Water.  Total damage was $5.15....what a deal!

The guy who took my order brought out the Pizza on paper plates.  The Pizza is thin sliced NY style Pizza.  The Pizza was pretty good.  Of course I folded it per standard MO for thin sliced Pizza.

Overall, it was a good experience.  I'll have to come back to try their pepperoni and veggie pizzas.

Will I return?  Of course!
Really good pizza. High prices though I think. I wish the pricing were more affordable.

If you don't care about customer service, and only the food, read this paragraph. If you DO care about customer service, read onto the next half of my review: the food at this place comes lower than Digiorno. The pizza was cold, crust had no taste, ingredients over salty, the meatballs on it taste like the meatballs in Spaghetti-o's. The bread for subs taste like the bread comes from a generic Smith's brand. The garlic knots were dough-y and wayyyy too much oil. It looked like we had lip gloss on after eating them. None of the ingredients are of quality. You can tell they buy the cheapest crap they can then over charge you on it. Tastes NOTHING like NY pizza. To call themselves that is a disgrace. 

As far as customer service, this place does not do refunds even if THEY mess up. And don't even dare try to tell them they made a mistake or they will respond with a "no refunds" or a "well what do you want me to do about it?" How about run a good business, you ignorant pricks. We have ordered delivery twice and both times have been 20 minutes late so the food arrives cold. When I asked for a manager, they refused to give me the name. This is also the place that was on the news for calling a customer andher daughter "fat bitches" for givinf him a bad review. I wasn't there but I believe it. The owner is trash, judging by the one time I saw him and seen multiple times how he runs this restaurant. 
The place is run by a Bulgarian who recently bought the business and clearly has no people skills, no culinary knowledge on Italian food, and no personality to delegate as his employees suck as well - but I understand as he isn't the friendliest. Why WOULD they be nice when they have to report to a douche? He needs to manage a better, friendlier restaurant, have a chef come in to teach the staff better cooking and prep skills, and learn how to handle negative customer experiences like an adult, not like a 15 year old who forgot to take his bipolar medication.

I go to Novecento Pizza nearby. Much better quality, not cheap either but their ingredients are fresh and they offer a great menu. My tip to this business is leave Italian food to Italians or chefs and go work at a gas station. At 2 am. In the middle of nowhere on highway 5 where nobody has to run into you. That's all this owner is capable of...if even that...

My family lives less than 5 miles from this poor business and have been patrons of this business for years. We have noticed a steep decline in the quality of service and food preparation since new ownership took over, a few years back. Since then, we have only ordered once every few months, desperate for pizza. After our last experience, coupled with a COMPLETE lack of respect for other patrons, we will never be back and will be sure to tell others about such poor service and food.

Be sure to avoid any sandwiches on their menu as they like soggy bread and assume everyone else loves soaked bread too. I love oil and vinegar on my sandwiches but the one I ordered was disgusting, as was my mother's!! I couldn't believe it. Yeah, one might be a screwup but both sandwiches?... That's a standard they have there, soak your buns in oil and vinegar. -_- ew

Honestly, their pizza isn't bad but it's nothing special for sure. They tote about how expensive their ingredients are when you can tell that's bull. And if it's not, maybe they don't know how to prepare quality ingredients?

Really, the kicker, is how poorly they respond to any criticism or feedback. Be humble, be gracious, and be strong. I don't expect you to bow down at customers' feet but acknowledge when you screw up and try to fix it! When my mother called to let them know she couldn't eat her sandwich with how soggy it is, they claimed it was fine when it left so she must have messed it up. What?

Blaming customers for their obvious screwups, poor overall quality customer service, poor quality food, and long delivery times are all why this place is on my "never ever fckn go again"

"When the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie, that's Amore" my sentiments exactly. 

My friend was having a fit when we walked in. He had no idea it was a Boston mecca. The entire place is adorned with memorabilia from Boston. I was just there for the pizza. 

There were 4 of us. We ordered 2 large pizzas and some wings. Wings were really good, I had to stop myself at some point because I had to save room for pizza. The sauce was so good tho!

We ordered 2 large pizza, a Hawaiian and Veggie (with added sausage). The crust was perfect, had a nice crunch, not too thick, I was still able to fold my pizza. The toppings were excellent. 

We all had just finished a 10 mile hike, so the 4 of us devoured the 2 pizzas, but the slices were huge! We still had some leftovers to take home. 

I generally don't make it up to this area very often, but now I know where I'm eating after hiking in Mt. Charleston.

I was really looking forward to this pizza.  I had heard amazing things about it, and honestly, the crust didn't disappoint.  It was great.  However, I would say while the sauce was good, there needed to be more.  Same with the cheese.  Had a half pepperoni, half mushroom pizza, and the pepperoni side was definitely better.  Also tried the garlic potato chips.  Some were soggy, and overall they were too salty, but they were good.  Definitely better than store bought chips, and way cheaper at 75 cents for a medium-sized Ziploc bag.  Overall, the place was good, but I wouldn't go out of your way to eat there.  If you happen to be in the neighborhood though, go for it.
Best pizza in Las Vegas. Kind of expensive but really worth the cost. Beats the cheesus out of that phony dumbinos( dominos) or pizza slut (hut)

Good solid Pizza place ( and they deliver!)  Pizza was thin crust and not too soggy.  My husband liked the meatball pizza and the kids liked the sausage .

First good ( and large ) calzone I have had in 20 years with good fresh ricotta cheese and NO tomato sauce inside ( like we used to find in NY.

Picked up a pizza to go. After a 5 minute drive back it was pretty soggy but everyone enjoyed it nevertheless. Thin "east coast style" describes it perfectly. I would have it again next time I'm in town.
Nice and quaint spot tucked within a little shopping center in centennial hills.  Staff is friendly and they have some decent pizza!

By far the best pizza in the north with the Vegas been going here for 10 years my favorites but for real Northeast style pizza and calzone wouldn't go anywhere else after a hard day at work I like to come and talk to the friendly staff and get my Fix.

Love the pizza from here.  Great thin crust variety.  Want to branch out and do their Sicilian style sometime in the future.  Have gotten a calzone from here too.  One calzone would easily feed two maybe three people.  Think of a large pizza folded in half.  It's really come along as a locals place since it's opening.  Lunch time isn't too packed but weekend nights the high school crowd may be there in full,  but don't let that deter you from ordering to go.  It's worth it.
Had a softball group party. Came here last minute and they totally took care us. Great service. Good pizza! Thank you North End. From inland empire dynasty softball team!

So we usually order from here often, but today's order was a little off. The hot sauce for the wings was a little oily. Didn't taste pleasant. Disappointed. Along with the pizza didn' t taste like anything special. Not to sure if I'd order from here again.

This place is legit.  Just like Pizzeria Regina.  Former owner from the North End.  The sports memorabilia will make you smile and so will the pizza.  Super friendly.  Worth the trip up from Summerlin.  I won't go elsewhere for pizza any more.

I've eaten there twice in the past month and I live no where near this place.  The pizza is always worth the drive.  I love the crust, its perfect and ingredients taste fresh.  Never oily or greasy.   Friendly staff.

Been here a few times and having lived in New York and Italy the food is Meh at best.  Customer service was the part that sucked the most.  I'm OK with so-so pizza if it's right there...but when you have crappy service and an attitude of indifference to the customer it really drives one to go elsewhere.  Food wont kill you, but I'd only go back if I was half inebriated and starving.  My two cents....

The White Pizza was just OK to us - we thought we would be blown away but we weren't
The House made Garlic Potato chips were really good to me but, Man you'll need some extra strength tic tacs/gum - maybe rinse with Listerine -cause you'll be smelling that Garlic for a while.
We honestly thought that we would be getting some made in house Italian Ice but was surprised to recieve Marco's Italian Ice - The chocolate was gross to us - It reminded us a fat free frozen chocolate pudding
Anyways, we aren't completely wrighting this place off ..... We may try other stuff......

I ordered a slice of pepperoni pizza and it was disgusting.  1st there was just a taste of pepperoni on the pizza, second the cheese tasted fake. I had to call and ask if they use real cheese on the pizza. I googled the cheese, forgot the name, it is said to have a creamier taste. Just didn't taste like mozzarella. If you are a pepperoni and extra cheese pizza fan like me, Mr Jims has the best pepperoni deluxe pizza I have ever tasted! And this is coming from someone who has worked at Pizza Hut for the last 20 yrs off and on as an extra job.

Stopped ordering here because no matter how many times you repeat the order, the girl will mess it up somehow. After the third time we just gave up, sent the order back and went to metro pizza instead. The food is ok for the most part.

Wish I would have read the reviews before I ordered. That's all I have to say  for the business, you should consider taking these reviews into consideration, that's why they are there to help you. Wish you all the best.

Ordered 3 pizzas for delivery. All 3 pies had undercooked crust. The sauce was good but the cheese and other ingredients were substandard. I ordered from North End pizza instead of a chain pizza joint because I expected fresh, quality toppings. I was disappointed. First and last time I ordered from North End pizza.

Yummy... I ordered the Margherita pizza and a order of the medium chicken fingers. All you pizza lovers out there, bow down to this pizza. It was the best pizza I have had in a long time!!!  Classic Margherita with delectable red sauce, crispy, light crust, melty mozz and wonderfully fresh torn basil. All the parts are simple but they work so well together. Margherita is my favorite pizza and I've tried it all over the place. This is one of the best out there. If you like this type of pizza, this is the place to get it. 

The chicken fingers were juicy and super tender. The sauce was tasty and they were served how I prefer which is not totally soaked in sauce but more like the sauce was cooked in. Perfect with their Ranch dressing.

Overall, I was perfectly pleased with everything. I used GrubHub to order and pay including the tip. They delivered it in a timely fashion. My only minor complaint was that is was warm, not hot when it arrived, but what can you expect from delivery?  I'm not sure how much delivery this business does so it may not be cost effective to invest in insulated delivery containers or in car heated containers. Still, my overall experience was excellently delish!!!

Love this place!  We order from here about once a week.  Pizza is good, I'm told they even import the dough in from their native Boston.  Calzones are great and I love their zucchini sticks.  Their menu is maybe a little limited but anything you do get is good.  And they are super fast with delivery.

After checking out the website and reading the reviews I had to go to North End Pizza to try out their food. One simple word: delicious. I'm a New Yorker, a Yankees fan, happy to say they even have a Yankees table. Needless to say, the pizza was delicious; thin crust, great sauce, and just the right amount of cheese.The chicken Parm sub is delicious. It was so clean and the staff was great. This is now my favorite pizza place in the valley. Come give it a try and you will not be disappointed.

Very sad. I used to love this place years ago and clearly something has changed. We placed our order and my sub came out so oily and soggy on the bottom that the meat fell out. They made my daughters sub wrong after repeating what she wanted twice so when I went up there to tell them no mushrooms ( like I asked for) he said "oh she doesn't like them"? When I walked away apparently they both gave me a dirty look. The fries were good though
Edit...just got a message from George that works there, calling me a bitch and my child fat...classy people that work there! How about focus on your food than making fun of kids...clearly from the reviews, we aren't the only ones who think this place is bad
Two slices of pizza and a drink for around five bucks?! Can't beat that! Not much to say delicious pizza good prices and good customer service one of my favorite places to grab a quick bite.

Ended up coming to north end due to my normal pizza by the slice placed were either closed or did not do their specials on Monday(kinda disappointed). The only reason for two stars is the employees were very nice. I ordered the cheese slice, side salad and drink special, the pizza wasn't absolutely disgusting but not great either. I added mozz cheese and croutons to my side salad and the croutons I couldn't even eat they were disgusting, the salad was ok. The ranch not so much it tasted like they get a big tub of hidden valley and put in the single dressing containers. Would I ever come back? Only if this was literally the last pizza place on earth. I will make a drive out to another one of my pizza places to get pizza... I didn't want to drive far for pizza but it would have been worth it.

The owner is a nice guy, he let me try the cheese pizza while I waited for my to-go order. The staff is very friendly and the resturant is very clean. Best pizza in town. I highly recommend, this place is a local's secret spot! 5 stars!

I don't know why this shop doesn't get more respect. The food is great, particularly the sauce. I've had pizza, calzones and now a chicken parmesan sandwich from this shop. It looks like they have expanded their offerings to compete with other Italian style fuller menu restaurants around town. I went in yesterday because I was craving their sauce. I don't know what they put in it but it is so savory and delicious. Its like getting a warm hug from somebody's Italian grandma. I asked for a side of sauce and the cashier looked at me like I had two heads. The cook overheard and came out to correct me. He says, "You mean gravy?" I was like, "yeah, can I purchase a side of gravy?" Crisis diverted. I work in the area and would love if they did a soup of the day in the fall and winter months. 

I was even able to order my food via Yelp and the Eat24 software so when I got there, I had already paid for it. I like the decor, you feel like you are in an old school Italian restaurant. Unfortunately, it's not normally crowded but the wall pictures are very interesting and reason to linger.

Worst customer service! They didn't indicate that their chicken wings are breaded on the menu, when they showed up and i couldn't eat them i called and they just said they were  pre- breaded when they get them and then they couldn't care less that their menu was wrong. Grub hub even contacted them as they wouldn't give me a refund. The fries were limp and the sandwiches we're standard. I definitely won't be ordering from them again, their process are way too high for the food you get (refer above to their pre-breaded wings they get).

Garlic knots and a small supreme = +$18!?!? The pizza was alright. Would not pay this much for 4 slices again. 

Garlic knots lacked that kicked in your face garlic flavor with bad breath until tomorrow sensation. Wouldn't order those again either.

It was O-K.  I give them two stars because the service was bad.  I showed up 30 mins before closing.  The cashier warned me and said if we were still there after closing she gets a annoyed.  Also, 15 mins prior to closing the staff was already moving chairs around and trying to clean up the dining area while there were customers still eating.  This place is close to my home but would rather drive further for better food and service.

Must say, the pizza is pretty damn good! This pizzeria is RIGHT next to my nail shop but I've avoided trying it out due to mixed Yelp reviews. Well, Yelp, you've steered me wrong! I could have been enjoying a tasty slice right after getting pampered! We got an extra large pepperoni pie and garlic knots, both were delish. Garlic knots are seasoned just right and the pizza was cheesy, perfectly thin, and carried just enough sauce. Very well done North End. I look forward to frequenting this restaurant.

I found hair in my food, turns out staff doesn't wash hands or wear hair nets or gloves!! Very bad service. I called to complain The owner hung up in my face, I got the garlic knots and they were real soggy, watched how they mix the tomatoe sauce with the paste using bare hands. That's disgusting. I will not give this place my business and suggest the whole community boycotts.

I've lived in Vegas for almost 20 years and being a fan of good quality food is a on going hobby of mine. My Mother in law turned me on to North end and what a awesome pizza the dough and crust are the best I've ever had ! They are generous on sauce and cheese. but the reason i"m giving 4 stars instead of 5 is there skimpy on toppings if you want the best pizza experience here you have to spend a little more for extra toppings.But worth it!

The worst pizza that I've had in my 51 years, called to complain and asked if we could get another pizza because the one they brought was soggy and very cold. They said no, I then asked for money back and was then hung up on.

I've heard good things about the place and just happened to be in the area.   Two slices with 2 toppings,  and drink around 8 bucks.   Pizza was very good, thin crust with a nice crunch,  and hot.  Excellent service as well.

we ordered a large sausage and pepperoni pizza to go from here.  Yikes! The oil slick on top of the pizza soaked through 3 paper towels and I still felt sick from the grease on the one piece I dared to eat.  Dominoes across the street is cheaper and much better than this
We moved here a few months ago and found North End Pizza to our liking. We haven't had a bad one here yet.

Friends and I were hesitant about ordering take out here, especially from a place we've never been to and only had few reviews here on Yelp.  What the hell, we ended up ordering two X-Large pizzas, garlic knots, and 40 pieces of wings...

And to our surprise, the New York Style pizza was fresh and the wings were even better!  The crunchiness of the wings was perfect..  Highly suggest the wings.

Give this place a try if your close by and looking for great tasting pizza and wings.

The pizza is really good and the closest to East coast pizza I have found since moving to Vegas. I've tried a few toppings, like meatball, pepperoni, and pineapple, and all of them were yummy. Mozzarella sticks are standard and delicious as is the meatball parmesan sandwich. Lastly, they have something called fried dough...I thought it was like funnel cake but it is not. Their fried dough is literally fried pizza dough sprinkled with cinnamon and sugar...how could it be bad? It's not, it's great and it's only $3.50!

We came here after finding Slidin Thru was closed . We were hungry so we ordered a large pizza. It was half pineapple/ ham and the other side had pepperoni, mushrooms, green pepper and onions. It was a good pizza but a little greasy. We also ordered  the garlic knots which were a nice size. It was a nice filling meal!

I am always hesitant to try pizza places that claim to be just like those that I miss from back in Boston. I have passed North End Pizza many times and thought to myself "yeah right". Then I tried it. I could tell by the smell when I walked in it was going to be good. Service was great, decor was great...and the food was AMAZING, right down to the fried dough! If you miss New England pizza...PLEASE try this place, you won't be sorry!!!

I always like coming into a place where you are greeted like a friend. The pizza here tastes great and you really can't beat the price for a hand tossed pie on this side of town either. I love that they do pizza by the slice so if you are looking for a quick bite for the kiddos or yourself you can poo in grab a couple and hit the road no problem. They keep the menu just big enough to have what you need and a few more items to spare which is nice too its a pizza place so i. Glad they try to keep it that way too many times now you see places trying to be the entire one stop shop which always seems to mess up the rest of the food. Give this place a try if you are near it enjoy some of the old time music and the friendly staff stay for the meal and I promise you will not leave ungappy.

Yelp reviews led my brother to North End Pizza. My brother in turn led me to North End Pizza.

  What a special! $6.23 for two large thin slices with a topping and medium cup of bottomless cola. It is my understanding that this special is all day.

  The North End Pizza slices tasted identical to the delicious pizza that I grew up with in Long Island, NY. If I was wearing a blindfold, I would not tell the difference from North End Pizza and the pizzarias of Long Island, NY. And if I was wearing a blindfold, I would miss the glowing reviews for North End Pizza and pictures of Boston posted on the walls.

  Next time that I visit North End Pizza, I will try the eggplant parmegaina hero. I am thrilled to see it in a Las Vegas pizzaria.

  I know that I am a fan of North End Pizza, when the worst thing I could write is that its too bad the owners have not  opened a  South End Pizza near Henderson.
Great pizza, awesome service! Will definitely be coming back. I would recommend this place to anyone that loves fresh pizza

If only you could give zero stars!! Not only did they mess up our order after asking clarify it four times, one of the workers threatened my husband. We asked for our money back and as we left the store the worker chased my husband out yelling curse words and calling him obscene things threatening to fight him. Uncalled for. It was just two orders of chicken fingers. We won't be back. Ever. ALL of our friends will hear about this.

I love North End my boss got me on this place at a party! We order the white pizza with salami seriously the absolute best white pizza I've ever had! It's always perfectly cooked and not too greasy! They're Pepperoni and sausage is also very tasty I'm not much for Chain places they usually give me heartburn but this place has really made me happy! Try it!

Have come here for past 2 years. Always had delicious food and great service. Got pizza and wings today, not good. Since ownership change food was not the same. Wanted to give them a chance..chicken wings were very bad. Probably worst I ever had. Don't think I'll be going back again.

WHITE PIZZA is the most amazing thing I have ever tasted. Imagine this delicious thin crunchy crust loaded with cheese, garlic, and olive oil.

I usually take-out but I finally ate at the location. All the tables were very clean, they featured the Boston vs Yankees game on multiple flat screens. Customer service was fantastic and they were playing songs from the Rat Pack big plus for me. Great music, great game, great FOOD. 

I never though pizza could be this good until I tried this specific pizza and this specfic location. I catch myself eating here at least once a month! Their fried zucchinis and ranch are absolutely the best also, not forgetting to mention their cannolis.

Taking a bite of their white pizza is like heaven!

Every wed night is pizza night at my daughter's house and they order a lot of pizza from North End Pizza. They are dairy free and ask for no cheese.  These aren't small orders with a minimum of 3 adults and 3 growing boys. Last time they ordered they got home to find cheese on all their pizzas. They took them back and we're told not only would their order not be corrected but we're told by the OWNER that if they didn't like it they should take their business elsewhere. They didn't even get an apology.  Pizza is good but customer service SUCKS. There are too many pizza places to treat customers like this. And no reason to be RUDE in any situation. If you don't mind being treated like dirt if they happen to screw up your order I guess North End Pizza is for you. But NOT for my family. They have placed the same order for mos.  Guess they don't appreciate good,  loyal customers.

Being from Massachusetts, one of my biggest issues with LV is the lack of great pizza.  We found this place late (9 pm on a Thursday) on our way home from a Christmas party.  I LOVED the décor.  It was great pointing out to my husband all the places we have been and I have been with out him.  We ordered garlic knots and a large supreme pizza to dine in.  We also ordered two fountain sodas.  The fountain soda was well calibrated.  The garlic knots came out quickly, but even though we were starving, they were nothing to rave over.  The pizza game out a few minutes later.  While I enjoyed crust, my husband found it tough and did not eat the ends.  I liked the flavor of the pizza, but I found that the crust couldn't hold up to the weight and moisture of the toppings.  Less toppings might be better?  If we were in the area we would go there again, but would not drive out of our way.

Being a Bostonian and having been searching for a pizza that is a REAL pizza, I can finally say I HAVE FOUND IT!!!!. This is without a doubt THE BEST PIZZA in Vegas. Delicioso. You haven't eaten pizza if you haven't eaten here.

It just a simple pizza place, but that's why I like it. I have read reviews about people getting whole pizzas and being disappointed but my husband and I have only tried their single slices and garlic knots, and we have been satisfied every time. The staff is nice and it's just a very relaxing laid back place that serves a good slice of pizza. We go there about once a month when we get a craving. I think most people's misconception is that it is just a "pizza place" but having that said, I would go here over any dominos etc, north end is just WAY better than those places. 

Hope that helps! :)
I love this pizza spot! It's really delicious, a wide variety of specialty pizzas and a perfect option for Football Sundays or fight night!

Being from NYC, i know a good slice when I taste one and this place was not it. Bland, undercooked, and all around disappointment. 

Owner is absurdly rude. If I want that, I'll cook my own pizza rolls and then berate myself in the mirror. 1 star is too generous for this dive.
Don't order from this place!! The manager is horrible and pizza is equally disgusting.
A quaint little Mom~n~Pop Pizza joint that is very YUMM.  HUGE SLICES, Tons of high quality cheese, delicious crispy crust, good prices, clean shop and friendly service.  What's not to like??

I've seen all the great reviews and figured I'd give them a try and I'm sure glad I did. Ordered delivery tonight and it was here 20min earlier than expected. We got wings, a supreme and half cheese/half Hawaiian and it all was fantastic. Awesome crust by far from anything I've had, reminds me almost of Metro but not as overpriced. Worth a try if you're in the area, lunch specials also look great and the portions are huge. Only reason I'm giving 4 stars is that the wings were quite small but had great flavor and texture and also not overpriced. Easy online ordering is a plus.

My favorite pizza place in town. The caprese salad is so fresh and delicious. Also the best pizza dough and I love the cheese they use. Also their ranch is the business, I always order extra so I can have some at home.

Short and sweet update-

Got a few weeks ago take in with Elnino F. Can't beat the lunch deals which are from $4-10 bucks for a filling meal and drink. 

Got 2 slices (added 2 toppings), a drink and some homemade chips for $8 and some change. 

The slices are big. It's probably more pizza than a personal plate sized pizza

Still one of my fave pizzas and I wouldnt say I'm really into pizza even.

Pizza good but terrible customer service - the hours say they choose at 9 but if you walk in to eat at 830p the girl there immediately informed you that the coming room is closed and you have to order take out - also is you do happen to get there before 830p and are eating in the dining area should you want to order something at 830p you are rudely asked if you will be taking it out because they close at 9p and they make you feel that you have to leave - don't think I will eat there again. THIS WAS WRITTEN A FEW MONTHS AGO NOT SURE WHY ONLY NOW IT POSTED

My fiancée bought a groupon for this place. $10 for $25 worth of food & drink. We ordered a large pizza with grilled chicken and roasted red peppers, zucchini spears, a cannoli, and two drinks. 

The pizza was SO good! The sauce is probably the best pizza sauce I've ever had. The crust is tasty, and there was a good ratio of cheese to sauce to toppings. I'm sure that all boils down to personal preference though. If your go-to pizza is deep dish, then this may not be the place for you. I loved it though. 

The zucchini spears were great too. I've never had fried zucchini before, but hey it's really good!

The cannoli was good. Not the best I've ever had, but the filling was nice. 

And the place was packed when we got there. Seems like others like it too. 

I'd recommend this place for sure.

Also, the staff were really friendly, which is always a big plus!

I tried this North End Pizza joint today...  I have had their pizza before, but it wasnt fresh... I liked it cold...Well after a round of golf my cousin and i were craving pizza and some wings... The wings were breaded Hooters style,,, they were frozen...  I ordered them medium.. I liked them and would order them again.. We ordered a medium pepperoni pizza,,, I didnt care for the dough too much, it lacked that chewy crispy texture i like. The sauce was good,, nice taste,, and the cheese and meat were very greasy,, but i didnt mind...  For a medium pizza for 11.99 it was a tad pricey but i finished my half add an order of wings a drink and a beer.the total bill came to 29.10...  I guess it wasnt too bad..  In closing this place didnt deliver, the way i hoped they would... I give them a 3 starts barely, mostly due to the wings..  There isnt too many options in that area for pizza, this place isnt bad... At the corner of durango and centennial..  HOPE THIS YELPS,,,

Disgusting. I have never seen a cockroach inside a restaurant until today. I saw the cashier handle my food without washing his hands, after cleaning and taking my payment. 
The only take away from this is that the guy was friendly and the prices are fair. Regardless a roach in the kitchen does not belong.

Amazing pizza! I go here quite a bit for lunch and the cheese pizza is tasty! Customer service is great and they are always super friendly. I usually get the pizza/salad lunch special (somewhat healthy?) and it's always consistently good. Pricing is great and they have a good variety on the menu. The pizza is also just the perfect amount of crispiness which I love!
Pizza was salty and wings were just ok. Service was pleasant enough, but not enough to warrant another  visit.

Damn. I read this place has new owners. What a shame.

We've been going to this joint since it opened. Always loved the pizza. 
Whoever bought it out did not keep the damn recipes. It's super unfortunate. Because it wasn't good at all. Especially for the prices. This is not worth the debit card purchase that is now debited out of my checking account. 

We tried:

Pepperoni - so hard to get wrong. But they changed the crust. 
White pizza - no. It was so bad, I couldn't even finish it. For me, I almost always finish my food. 
Garlic knots - merh, meh, meeeepppp. Nope. 


I feel this review isn't very articulate. Whatever. I'm bummed.
The pizza was good. But nothing special. Also the pies are expensive compared to other comparable places in the area. The delivery is quick though. It's definitely okay and but not great.

I'm not good at giving bad reviews as there are plenty of them to go around so I try to leave positive comments. I tried really hard and I was very patient with these folks when I called for a delivery. The gentleman on the  other end  of the line was nice , but was terribly discombobulated. I was on hold for a while and then he hung up on me by accident. When I called back, he was frustrated and put me on hold again. I decided to find another place. And I'm glad I did.

I received a "compliment"  from the owner of the establishment: (as written by this individual)
"...it's not about the phones for you it is about that you are a fuking dumb ass who doesn't know what good pizza is it, you c@ck sucker."

The abuse continued in another message when he referred to me as "American white trash" with a bunch of other nonsense that I had to delete.

A solid 4 star pizza spot!  It is right down the street from home too, so that is convenient!  If you are on this neck of the woods, I would recommend trying it!

Overall, the pizza is very fresh and delicious.  We went with two white pizzas (what we always get), and they were very tasty.  The pizza here is thin crust, cut wide with plenty of goodies.

We also tried their garlic chips and garlic knots....yes, we had an overwhelming amount of garlic, but it was worth it :)  

Service was pretty quick for a fresh made pizza joint.

Only reason why I didn't step up to the 5th star was the pricing.  It was a reasonably priced place, but I think I spent $35+ for two small pizzas with one topping, garlic knots, and chips...no drinks.  It was worth it to me, but might not be to you...The specials look like a cheaper way to go...the two slices + drink etc.

It was very good, but for the hometown feel pizza joint and the atmosphere, it felt a little spendy.  For instance, Grimaldis is the about the same price, but has that cheap date night / glass of wine atmosphere.  

Either way, you won't go wrong with this place!  I will be back for more!

This was my first time ordering food from here, food was great.  I ordered the chicken parm dinner and the chicken fingers.  Chicken fingers were very good not to saucy, and the chicken parm was huge vey big portions!!.  Great prices fast service.  Will definitely be ordering from here again.

Honestly, being from back East, I KNOW pizza!!!!  And this place is the s@@@!  I would totally eat there at least 3 or 4 times a week, but I'm sure my girlfriend would end up hiding the phone so I can't call it in.  
I believe that the dough and the sauce are imported from back home.  Probably why I'm drawn to it :)

Talk about most disgusting pizza I've ever had. How dare you even compare yourselves to ny pizza. Getting my pizza it is soggy and pitiful to even look at. The second you take a bite it tastes like baby food in your mouth. There was so much garlic on my pizza I swear I'll be smelling like it for a week. I am so upset that we just spent 33 dollars on a pathetic pizza like this. Never again will I give this place my money. Way to ruin our family take out night.

UPDATE: just called the place and got redirected to five different employees because they couldn't understand English.... then I get a guy who has an attitude with me for telling him my pizza is absolutely awful. This place has no respect for their costumers what so ever. I cannot believe this place. I'm absolutely appalled.

I've been wanting to try this place as it has been rated well on Yelp and I am all about good eats. I usually get my pizza at Rocco's on Charleston but, thought I would try North End. 

I phoned in for pick up, as their delivery area is limited. When ordering they told me 15 mins., I got there in just under 15, maybe 12. My order was ready. I was hungry so stuck my hand into my bag with the side of fries-and they were fresh, hot, delicious! Did not check the pizza but, drove home in about 12 mins. Fries were still fresh, warm/crisp and delicious. I open the pizza box, and the pizza looked a little unappetizing. It looked like cold pizza (like when you see, left over pizza from your fridge, the next day) and didn't look super cheesy but, I was hungry so I dived into my medium with eggplant and mushrooms.

It was warm, and came to the conclusion it must have been done, like maybe 5-7 mins after I called in. So now at my house, it was about 20+ mins from being oven fresh. The toppings were plentiful-worth the $1 per ingredient, the crust was good but, soggy towards the middle-I'm guessing a result of being 20+ mins from oven freshness. Something interesting was the eggplant was thinly sliced, breaded and fried-not what I was expecting but OK-good I think.

Bottom line, pizza rating 3/5 - if I'm in Centennial and want a slice, I would stop here and try eating in, to see how I like the pizza fresh from the oven, it may make a big difference and result in a higher rating.

Ordered the Sicilian pizza which I've had there many times before. On the last time the dough didn't rise and the pizza was flat as a thin crust. Called back and I was told that's how it is, which I know for a fact it is not. They would only offer me a 10% discount on my next purchase. No thanks. Go to above the crust instead.

How awesome! Found a great east  coast traditional place! Felt like I was back home in Boston! Love the atmosphere. Go Pat's!  Great food and the slices are huge!  Even my Jet fan hubby  loved the place#

I was finally able to cross North End Pizza off my bookmark list when my husband and I came here for dinner recently. Located off the 215 and Durango, North Pizza is nestled inside a small shopping center that houses Braddah's and a local Gyro shop. 

12" VEGGIE CALZONE ($12.99): Large enough to feed two and piping hot. Very bland in flavor though. The calzone crust was the biggest disappointment. It was thin and appeared to not have been dressed with any type of seasonings, to include olive oil. It was just plain ol' dough. I have to say, I expected better from a pizza joint and have had better calzones at standard local's bars. 2/5 

CHICKEN WINGS x10 ($7.99): Served with only 1 choice of sauce but very satisfying for a hungry hunter like my husband. Husband said they were good, but still below BWW's. 4/5

FRIES ($2.59): We paid and extra $0.50 to have garlic added. A-OK. 3/5

VIBE: Is it just me, or do all these hole in the wall pizza places look exactly the same? Newspaper clippings, black and white photos of celebrities, and East Coast regalia line the walls. 3/5

SERVICE: Staff are dressed super causal but are friendly enough. 3/5 Food came out within 15 minutes for everything, although it came out in succession. The manager okay'd this with us first. 3/5

Worth a Return Visit?
We paid $29 and some change for our meal, which I thought was pretty expensive for what we got. There are plenty of pizza spots closer to home, and the food quality really doesn't justify a second trip back. I'll keep looking for that perfect calzone!

YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #241

We eat here about once a month. We love the pizza, it may be a tad pricey but it's always good. It's not too greasy and the sausage is great. We've had a few other items but usually just go with the pizza.
Love this place, order at least 1 time every two weeks from the eat24 app. Pizza is real good, wings are awesome and kids love the ravioli.

Pros:
The white pizza was great!
Garlic knots were really good.
Great Boston decor (I am a die hard celtics/pats/sox fan originally from Mass)

Cons:
It's out in the boonies!

REAL North East style pizza from a real northeaster.

They get their dough shipped every couple months from a bakery in Lawrence, MA (I grew up not too far from there). Why? The hard water in Las Vegas is awful for making dough. Some pizzerias treat their water. Some claim to get their water shipped. Some don't care and just make crummy pizza.

North End Pizza is the best. I live in Mountains Edge and while it is a MASSIVE PAIN driving to northwest bum---- it is worth every mile. The pizza is the closest thing to home I've ever had in the valley. The crust is foldable, perfect consistency. Love it. Great ingredients. Its one of those places that, in Boston, would "just be another place for pizza" but in Vegas, where finding a great pizza is near impossible, it's THE place for pizza. 

I am a purest, and like pepperoni and mushroom, but their white pizza is insane. So tasty.

Claudia runs the place, and she is the real deal. Huge personality, from Boston originally... It's worth the trip.
Really good for northwest Vegas!  Garlic chips that come for free were outstanding!

Vegas offers better than this place.  The bad attitude alone is enough to deal with.  Although this place is close to home, I'll travel five miles to Rocco's for a better slice. Surprised that this place survives up here. But I guess those Boston people like it.

Horrible service. Called them and tried to use thier coupon and instead of giving me a new price they hung up on me after saying they'll "just take care of it". Then when I called back to cancel, mind you this is within a minute, and they said they made the order which was a $75.00 order which shouldjust have been $50.00. Then they said they where going to delivwr deliver it anyway and I had to pay for it, I told them anything they sent I would not pay for and they ended the conversation with a pleasant "fuck you". If this is how they are and I was just ordering I could just imagine how crappy thier food is.

Avoid this place like the plague.

I should jus copy and paste my review from upper crust this place is very similair ok exactly the same (seen staff from uppercrust there) either way this place is great and now it's only a 3 min drive great for lunch 2 slices and a soda for  less then  $6

I've given this place many tries, plus, my mom thinks they are from heaven, so she orders their pizza A LOT. 
The pizza is not bad. It really isn't. It's just not good either. The price of one large cheese pizza is 13$ plus tax, 16 inches. It's very thin, and looks kinda blah. There's really no flavor to it, it's just, bland. As for the price, I personally think it's too much for what you get.
I can drive down the street and order a an 18inch cheese pizza from Mark Rich's for 16$, that is far tastier for the extra 3$.
My fav pizza place in the whole city!   I'll drive all the way to 215 and Durango from Summerlin or even Southwest!  PERFECT!!!!

We used to order from here. The last time we ordered, it was disappointing. The crust was not good and the overall taste was bland. I don't think I'll give them another chance unless the original owners return.
Food wasn't good, the pizza was very greasy! Terrible service, the owner yelled at his employees while we were in the restaurant...

This is probably one of my favorite pizza places in Las Vegas.

The crust is thin and folds perfectly.  The crust is light with some body and has a nice crunch.  Just the right amount of sauce and cheese. 

The service is always good.  I usually go there for lunch special.   This is worth the trip if you are looking for some good pizza.

This place touts "Authentic East Coast Pizzeria" but I don't know know what that means. I've never eaten pizza on the East Coast. I tried the place out because I live in the neighborhood. 
It's the type of pizza that you fold to eat. Perhaps this place delivers what it promises. The pizza wasn't bad, it just wasn't for me. Perhaps I am not the target demographic.

Why is this place not packed to the brim?!? We LOVE it here!! It smells like authentic pizza restaurants in New York, the music is classic, food is GREAT, the decor is mobster, and the staff is super friendly. The ambiance sets the tone for an amazing restaurant. PS, try the Philadelphia cheesesteak, you won't regret it .

I've heard good things about North End pizza but I was disappointed. We ordered a medium supreme pizza and mozzarella sticks. The medium pizza was small and greasy. It was chewy and it seemed like it had been sitting for a while and then reheated. The mozzarella sticks cost $7 and they were the exact same brand as the ones served at the Walmart deli. That really made me mad. If a business is going to buy subpar products at least sell them at cost. Don't waste your money!
I grew up in NYC and I find North End's pizza to be subpar. Their wings are ok. When I read earlier reviews saying they had the best pizza in town I had to LOL and wonder if these folks get out much!

:( absolutely ridiculous. I have no idea how this place has 4 stars. Ordered delivery today, few subs and some sides. Absolutely horrible. Greasy, flavorless, and just overall nothing Italian or NY or good about it. I wouldn't recommend it and I'm still baffled at the high reviews. 

Delivery guy was super rude. We ordered online and the tip was calculated from get go and included. He just had to write us a "nice" text when he left . 

Never again.

Recently moving to Vegas! Didn't realize how hard it will be to find gooooood Pizza.  Man the struggle is real! I come from the east coast and this is as close to east coast that I came by. Thank you! Also the staff is friendly and very inviting. Came over to talk to me, ask how was the food. Very nice place and great pizza. Can't wait to go back.

We used to love North End when it was still with the previous owners. Everyone was very friendly. Since the new owner, we feel the quality of food and service has diminished. The last time we went there, they brought out our dessert before our pizza arrived. The pizza tasted different than before. We will seek elsewhere for pizza.

I live very close to North End Pizza. I am a vegetarian, but however i try to stay away from dairy. We eat pizza a couple times a month and i was reading the great reviews so had to try it. We felt like we were ripped off. We got a large cheese pizza and the crust was great. Fast forward it was overpriced and there was very lite sause  and like no cheese on it. It was pathetic. My wife is a two slice person at most and two of their slices was not even as filling as one slice of pizza at Marc Rich's or Broadway where we normally go. The pie was insulting and stingy. I don't know how people can rave about this pizza. It was like bread with good taste. Skip this place if you like cheese on your pizza. RIP OFF.......

Definetely agree with the latest reviewers, new owners and not a good thing. We've been coming here for years, and always order the same thing-white pizza. Used to be amazing! Now, expect garlic from a jar (not fresh) and bottled spices. Very little ricotta cheese, olive oil was okay. Cant believe its so much different. The only reason for 2 stars is we also ordered the mac and cheese bites and they were okay. For an $18.99 large pizza, I will surely be getting my white pizza fix elsewhere. So bummed because tho solace used to be the best!
